666401869.name: Amazing crafts!!
666401869.author: a TripAdvisor user
666401869.reviewBody: This is a must visit in Tlaquepaque. Outstanding ceramic and pottery work both regarding technique and aesthetics. Contemporary and traditional ceramics from all over Mexico in one place.

itemReviewed.name: Ceramic Museum (Museo Regional de la Ceramica)

629168182.name: Exceptional museum quality ceramics
629168182.author: a TripAdvisor user
629168182.reviewBody: As part of a walking tour organized by our hotel, Quinta Don Jose boutique hotel, this museum was most interesting with wonderful ceramics .

itemReviewed.name: Ceramic Museum (Museo Regional de la Ceramica)

613320295.name: Great small museum in the centro, and free!
613320295.author: a TripAdvisor user
613320295.reviewBody: A good variety of beautiful Jaliscan ceramics in an historic building with a lovely shaded courtyard.

itemReviewed.name: Ceramic Museum (Museo Regional de la Ceramica)

587292390.name: Creme de la Creme ceramics
587292390.author: a TripAdvisor user
587292390.reviewBody: Each year Guadalajara hosts a ceramic competition. The winning entries are housed in this museum. Prepare to be enthralled by a collection of artistry and craftsmanship. Admission is free. Put this collection at the top of your list in Guadalajara.

itemReviewed.name: Ceramic Museum (Museo Regional de la Ceramica)

582247132.name: Understand the mixing of indigenous and colonial culture through clay
582247132.author: a TripAdvisor user
582247132.reviewBody: Various winners of the National Ceramic contest have pieces here on display. The use of clay for everyday function and the styles and decor reflect the history & style of each region. I was able to tell right away pieces from my Chihuahua, up north. The history and myths depicted in either clay or the painting on the ceramics was lovely. Modern works reflected issues like women\'s rights in provocative works. This is not ceramics like they sell at Macy\'s or american shops. This is serious art that reflects the ethos of our people, our mixed cultures, religions and art.

itemReviewed.name: Ceramic Museum (Museo Regional de la Ceramica)

580872355.name: Well Worth a Stop
580872355.author: a TripAdvisor user
580872355.reviewBody: This small museum, located on Independencia, had lovely examples of different styles of ceramics.  Although it was small, it was well worth spending some time there, and a hot afternoon, it offered a cool (not air-conditioned) respite.

itemReviewed.name: Ceramic Museum (Museo Regional de la Ceramica)

572025224.name: Nothing so special to see
572025224.author: a TripAdvisor user
572025224.reviewBody: I really prefered much more walk on the really cute streets of Tlaquepaque :) \nThe museum is pretty small and pior signed.

itemReviewed.name: Ceramic Museum (Museo Regional de la Ceramica)

555268332.name: Visit this museum before going to other ceramics exhibits or galleries
555268332.author: a TripAdvisor user
555268332.reviewBody: This is a great place to learn about Mexican ceramics. It\'s small and simple, but each salon showcases a different type of ceramic and explains the technique that makes it unique. After visiting, you\'ll understand the different types of pieces you see elsewhere. We spoke to a man who worked there who explained the history of the building (built in the 1800s, it belonged to a very wealthy hacienda owner who schemed to be part of Maximilian\'s court) and some of the glasswork. Although the museum is simple, many pieces are very beautiful, and some, such as the collection of tiny figurines, are whimsical as well as impressive. \nSigns/explanations are in Spanish. Nice museum shop with beautiful pieces for sale and books also.

itemReviewed.name: Ceramic Museum (Museo Regional de la Ceramica)

537435819.name: Nice small museum
537435819.author: a TripAdvisor user
537435819.reviewBody: Well worth the time for a quick visit to this small place. There are several small rooms with different ceramic artwork in each.

itemReviewed.name: Ceramic Museum (Museo Regional de la Ceramica)

531866778.name: Enjoyed this little museum
531866778.author: a TripAdvisor user
531866778.reviewBody: Entrance fee is free.  Display was simple but clean.  Made the ceramic stand out.  Many nice pieces, some exquisite even.  Not a lot of explanation unfortunately. I recommend spend about 45 minutes to an hour here.

itemReviewed.name: Ceramic Museum (Museo Regional de la Ceramica)

580871918.name: Beyond Our Expectations
580871918.author: a TripAdvisor user
580871918.reviewBody: This museum was filled with extraordinary ceramic works of art - many different styles.  Room after room filled with amazing pieces!  We spent at least two hours there and could have stayed more.  Our only regret?  We had not carried our cameras with us, and iPhone photos do not do the intricacies of the patterns justice.

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

555269218.name: Incedible collection of ceramics, from the tiny to the gigantic
555269218.author: a TripAdvisor user
555269218.reviewBody: This museum shares a block with the Centro Cultural but is separate. It has a very large collection and some of the most beautifully crafted ceramics I\'ve ever seen. Go first to the smaller ceramics museum to understand the different types of ceramics, and then come here to see the extensive and elaborate pieces.

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

533583760.name: Museum visit
533583760.author: a TripAdvisor user
533583760.reviewBody: Great staff on hand and very helpful with purchasing and all. Couldn\'t ask for better service by staff.

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

500991637.name: best of the competition
500991637.author: a TripAdvisor user
500991637.reviewBody: this is the museum that houses the winners of the annual ceramics competition as well as great examples of modern Mexican ceramics.  Beautiful work in beautiful surroundings.  Well worth the walk- just a few blocks from Independencia. Works go back as far as the early 80\'s.

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

488480816.name: Fun to see
488480816.author: a TripAdvisor user
488480816.reviewBody: We had a little time to kill before a tour so we stopped into this place. We were pleasantly surprised on how nice our visit was. It is well worth your time to stop and see this place

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

459915124.name: Finally took the time- well worth it!
459915124.author: a TripAdvisor user
459915124.reviewBody: After living for years in Guadalajara, and then visiting many times after, I finally went to this museum and absolutely enjoyed every minute. Take your time to see the details in every piece of ceramic in display, especially with the miniatures! So much to see and admire!

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

458326901.name: Must See for Ceramic Lovers
458326901.author: a TripAdvisor user
458326901.reviewBody: The museum is unbelievable.  You walk through galleries  and side galleries and each room is more amazing. The displays are open and you can see the pieces from different angles. Each year, there is a competition from all over Mexico and winners are selected to be part of the permanent exhibit. The winners are displayed in a central location until the pieces are integrated into the main collection. Like every museum in Mexico you wish there were publications in English.We bought a book containing pictures of the collections. I could have spent hours looking at the pieces.

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

456684052.name: Beautiful Ceramic Exhibit
456684052.author: a TripAdvisor user
456684052.reviewBody: So glad that we visited this museum.  There were many displays of historic and modern ceramics....pottery.  Well displayed.

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

448057344.name: A must-see in Tlaquepaque
448057344.author: a TripAdvisor user
448057344.reviewBody: Impressive craftsmanship, beautifully displayed. A must-see to discover the richness and variety of Jalisco ceramic works.

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

362049538.name: Nice sample of local ceramic art
362049538.author: a TripAdvisor user
362049538.reviewBody: Nice museum.  Not too many people at any given time. Great show of miniature works too. Around the corner is the Centro Cultural Refugio, which sometimes have exibits.

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

357587353.name: Top of my list in Tlaquepaque
357587353.author: a TripAdvisor user
357587353.reviewBody: I think readers are confusing two museums. This is NOT the one on Independcia, but the one north of the  church.  \n\nThis museum is incredible. One, if not the finest, collection of Mexican ceramic art in the world. It includes pieces dating from the mid 1980\'s (if I observed correctly) until 2015, representing the most skilled artisans from eight states. We were there this morning Palm Sunday, the only visitors. Maestra Karla Veronica Juaregul Quintero was most helpful and enthusiastic about this \'maravilla\', and we bought two copies of an exquisite book about the museum and the award winning collection. Beautifully laid out, good lighting. What a joy.

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

352253546.name: Jaw dropping Mexican ceramics
352253546.author: a TripAdvisor user
352253546.reviewBody: Simply put, you are not going to find a better collection of contemporary and award winning high end Mexican pottery and ceramics made by the regional great masters.\nSome of these pieces are just stunning.  Yes, the little museum could use a makeover, the displaying is poor and almost cluttered, and obviously funding is an issue.  But just take 30 minutes for a wander through, it\'s free and worth your time.

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

343891891.name: Fabulous experience.
343891891.author: a TripAdvisor user
343891891.reviewBody: The Musro Pantaleon Panduro is a "must do" activity in Tlaquepaque.  Even if you\'re not usually all that interested in ceramics, you\'ll be astonished at the diversity and quality of the works on display here. This is easily one of the best ceramics museums in the world. Truly an amazing experience. Don\'t miss it!

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

283458638.name: Under extensive renovation- almost nothing to see
283458638.author: a TripAdvisor user
283458638.reviewBody: There was only one exhibit in the center courtyard, because the entire interior is being overhauled.

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

160116104.name: Wow!
160116104.author: a TripAdvisor user
160116104.reviewBody: The works in this museum were part of annual competitions and come from different areas in Jalisco. A lovely woman came up to us as we entered and took us through the museum explaining a great deal about the techniques used in each kind of ceramic in English.\nI was just blown away by some of the work. It was beautiful and intricate and SO varied. We went around the exhibit a second time by ourselves after our guide left us. \nThe museum is state supported and there is no charge. We would have liked to have made a contribution but that is a no no.

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

152672773.name: manager
152672773.author: a TripAdvisor user
152672773.reviewBody: it is sound good to go there, need to have a free mind and a relax body to be there,  you should have some one who know the place well with you

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

128978522.name: Incredible pottery
128978522.author: a TripAdvisor user
128978522.reviewBody: This museum has an outstanding collection of pottery and is well worth a visit for anyone interested in the pottery of the region.

address.streetAddress: Calle Prisciliano Sanchez 191 at calle Florida

666927695.name: Interesting exhibitions
666927695.author: a TripAdvisor user
666927695.reviewBody: The building is beautiful and has a few exhibitions. It\'s a nice place to enjoy some quiet and sit in the shade for a while.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

644168530.name: Beautiful collection
644168530.author: a TripAdvisor user
644168530.reviewBody: Small but spectabular collection of ceramics including the winners of the annual Presidential prizes for ceramics.  Exquisite pieces.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

591494882.name: Mystical place
591494882.author: a TripAdvisor user
591494882.reviewBody: This used to be a psychiatric hospital there is a night drama/terror play that explains what used to happen there. This is a very recommended tour to take but this is only in Spanish but I think anyone can understand by only watching the play. It is scary but really good.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

582246121.name: Honoring People who Contributed to Society
582246121.author: a TripAdvisor user
582246121.reviewBody: How lovely to see people sit in the shade around this rotunda that was built to honor those who contributed to society. From workers, insurgents, and intellectuals, it was refreshing to see this monument. Only two women were part of the statues.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

570253984.name: Rich in HIstory is an understatement.
570253984.author: a TripAdvisor user
570253984.reviewBody:
Founded by the Catholic Bishop of Guadalajara in the early 19th Century, this palace for housing and raising local orphans covered acres of land, with fountains and magnificent multiple courtyards. 
It is now home to revolving art exhibits from around the world, concerts, the Jalisco Ballet several times a year and the most important 'exhibit' the Frescoes of Clemente Orozco - one of the greatest Mexican muralists. 

The former chapel and dormitory are covered in some 54 massive frescoes which depict the history of Mexico and the vision of the artist for the future and purpose of humankind. 

Admission is almost free, and free one day a week.
It is at the end of the main pedestrian mall in Guad and the whole mall including the Cathedral and the Degollado Theatre deserve a visit as you amble.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

555269776.name: A cultural center in a one-time insane asylum
555269776.author: a TripAdvisor user
555269776.reviewBody: This is an old building of courtyards and small rooms that once housed patients.It\'s currently used for temporary cultural exhibits and events, which rotate through. When we were there, they had an exhibit of ceramic nativity scenes set up in many of the rooms. These were beautiful and well worth seeing. A student volunteer guided us through it. The cultural center shares this city block with the incredible Museo Premio Nacional de la Cer\u00e1mica Pantele\u00f3n Panduro, so you can easily see both at the same time.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

554690219.name: This building was once an orphanage and now an art gallery
554690219.author: a TripAdvisor user
554690219.reviewBody: A remarkably gorgeous building which we always enjoy.  The rotating art exhibitions are lovely, and walking through this very statuesque building with Canterra stone pillars is so elegant.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

507890419.name: Try to get to the roof for great view! Take the Night Tour! Good Scares and FUN!
507890419.author: a TripAdvisor user
507890419.reviewBody: The place is old and has a lot of history, yet there are many things lacking, such as clean and equipped bathrooms, a decent souvenir store and descriptive signs so you can read and know what you are seeing without the help of a tour guide. But try telling the Guide or people who work there to take you to the roof, the sight is very much worth it! But at night it is a whole other experience. You get a guided tour and it seems the building is lit with dim lights, so you get the feeling of a very old place full of secrets. As they explain the stories and myths of the place, actors spring out of nowhere to reenact the stories! Beware, some in your group may scream! Then laughing ensues! I only give it a 4 star rating because of the missing amenities. But it is worth a stop!

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

458537417.name: The heart of the City of Guadalajara and of Jalisco State.
458537417.author: a TripAdvisor user
458537417.reviewBody: Explore every arm of the cruciform public spaces surrounding the Cathedral to discover local history and culture.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

441836396.name: This was a quick stop outside downtown Guadalajara Plaza
441836396.author: a TripAdvisor user
441836396.reviewBody: First time to Guadalajara so we (co-worker and I) stopped by this area as it had a lot of history to it. There really wasn\'t too much to see at this place other than walk around  the monument for a few minutes.  It was very pretty to see and only took a few minutes. Worth a stop but don\'t expect to stay more than a few minutes.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

439583495.name: Part of beautiful downtown Guad!
439583495.author: a TripAdvisor user
439583495.reviewBody: Be sure to visit downtown Guadalajara. Walk and enjoy all the beautiful culture and architecture. There are lots of buildings to see and I am sure we missed a few. This was a pretty plaza for sure.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

431881302.name: Fantastic Ceramic Museum
431881302.author: a TripAdvisor user
431881302.reviewBody: This view pertains only to the ceramic museum that is housed adjacent to El Refugio.  Every year for 40 or so years the Center holds a completion for ceramic artists from around Mexico.  The museum houses many of the award winners from this competition.  The work is fantastic.  The level of talent in these pieces far exceeds what one can see in the regional museum of ceramic art on Calle Independencia.  I can\'t speak about the rest of the Centro Cultural El Refugio but the ceramic museum there is fantastic.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

406846959.name: Refugio see 2016.
406846959.author: a TripAdvisor user
406846959.reviewBody: Gates are open for special events. Ancient trees line the street. Bathrooms have been updated. Nice Reno.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

389904434.name: Must see!
389904434.author: a TripAdvisor user
389904434.reviewBody: Amazing place, a must see to understand the history of Guadalajara and its surroundings. I recommend the free guided tour. I believe it\'s free on Tuesdays

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

376731650.name: Not a lot to see, but good
376731650.author: a TripAdvisor user
376731650.reviewBody: We were brought to this building by our private tour guide.  Although the building had a lot of empty space, it is an interesting building architecturally and historically.  Aside from the architecture, I found the most interesting part to be a huge mural covering the walls and ceiling of the magnificent staircase.  Our guide made it really come alive for us with his explanation about the artist, the scenes, and the politics they represent.  It became truly fascinating!

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

369585161.name: Centro Historico Guadalajara.
369585161.author: a TripAdvisor user
369585161.reviewBody: The Historical District of Guadalajara is filled with Art, Culture, Music, great food  and a huge shopping district. I moved here 2 years ago from California and I am restoring a 200 hundred year old Colonial. There are many plazas where you can sit and people watch. There is ALWAYS something fun going on every weekend and it is usually free. The people are wonderful and the architecture amazing.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

331398411.name: Cultural Center
331398411.author: a TripAdvisor user
331398411.reviewBody: It seems this historical mansion, now used as a cultural center in Tlaquepaque, is a hit or miss attraction.  Artist selling their wares, or maybe a small event that focuses on visiting artisans, or nothing at all.  Try to find a schedule before going.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

320766117.name: So much to see.
320766117.author: a TripAdvisor user
320766117.reviewBody: On Saturday there are all of the markets, seemingly endless. I Took the touristy double decker busses (Tapatio Tours)  all over the city. It was so cool! I don\'t speak Spanish well but was able to get along great. People were very friendly.Street food was great.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

318778677.name: Beautiful
318778677.author: a TripAdvisor user
318778677.reviewBody: we walked around and it was just breathtaking. You must go and visit, take lots of pictures, they will come out beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

289065019.name: Cultural center
289065019.author: a TripAdvisor user
289065019.reviewBody: This is also @ the heart of the city guadalajra,jalisco. This place really beautifull with freedom fighters statues around and with mexican history information. This place has got good connectivity to tapatia hop on hop off buses services. This places is also near to major historic places of the city @ near by blocks. Shopping market like dowtime market is near by were we get different shopping items of mexico also to taste mexican food here.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

277562209.name: Good Culteral Center
277562209.author: a TripAdvisor user
277562209.reviewBody: Fun to watch the artists and view the many talented artisans create their wares. This is in a large old mansion which is a historical treat.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

273894701.name: Even the People who run it are surprised!
273894701.author: a TripAdvisor user
273894701.reviewBody: TripAdvisor gives the impression that this community center is akin to an art museum.  hence, we dutifully made the seven block walk to the Refugio.  All this to find a guard and a basically empty space.  Around the corner, the facility offered a chance for local children to learn to finger paint.  This was only one of several disappointments in Tlaqupaque.  You would be foolish to plan a night in this village, which is actually part of a suburb of GDL, based on a desire to enjoy this "museum."

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

253641543.name: Cultural heart of Guadalajara
253641543.author: a TripAdvisor user
253641543.reviewBody: This is a great place to start in Guadalajara! I was able to go on three bus tours of the city from this location for a great price! It\'s downtown in the center of the city nearby the Cathedral, plazas with fountains and statues, and other attractions. You haven\'t "been" to Guadalajara without going here.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

242431684.name: culturalv
242431684.author: a TripAdvisor user
242431684.reviewBody: Always something going on. This time it was all about artists from oaxaca. Different vendors selling different handmade items. All came with a story how and who made them

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

236944558.name: Great place to pickup a double-decker bus tour
236944558.author: a TripAdvisor user
236944558.reviewBody: This is a beautiful central location.  I checked out a few of the beautiful buildings & churches, then picked up a double-decker bus here and took a tour of the city.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

215534958.name: No art to see, just junk for tourists
215534958.author: a TripAdvisor user
215534958.reviewBody: It seems that this place is very well known for hosting various art exhibitions... I went there yesterday hoping to find interesting local artists to talk to  and saw no art... ( being an artist myself I can be a little judgemental) all I found were exhibitions of painted canvases supposedly called paintings by artists. It took me a while to get there and it was not worth the effort mostly because all I found in the little town were stalls with knick knacks and bad craftsmanship. Very low quality good for tourists who want to but cheap stuff. I would give the place 1 star, if it were not for just 2 galleries in Tlaquepaque which host very good furniture and high quality chandeliers , which made the trip a little worthwhile

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

203910866.name: INTERESTING
203910866.author: a TripAdvisor user
203910866.reviewBody: Wish they would have had the displays in English as well, without knowing much Spanish, we could only look at the displays and not get the history behind them

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

181532120.name: Beautiful display of Spanish Colonial architecture
181532120.author: a TripAdvisor user
181532120.reviewBody: This is a beautiful city, very interesting to see everyday life happen amidst such beautiful antiquity. Heavy wrought iron balconies and church doors, squares, churches, there\'s nothing I did not like about this culturally rich city. Very warm people, Excellent local food.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

155614114.name: An empty building
155614114.author: a TripAdvisor user
155614114.reviewBody: Perhaps I was there at the wrong time but this was a totally empty building.  Nobody bothered me while I wandered through but there was nothing to see.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

152672716.name: manager
152672716.author: a TripAdvisor user
152672716.reviewBody: it is a good place to visit, but too expensive for me, would not go there if I do not have money enough to spend with me

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

151990994.name: I love the culture
151990994.author: a TripAdvisor user
151990994.reviewBody: There is so much to see and learn in beautiful downtown in and around El Centro Cultural. This is a highlight of a trip for tourists.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

144688446.name: history
144688446.author: a TripAdvisor user
144688446.reviewBody: My father grow up in this town, it is always good to see where I come from. Great location, small attraction. Good for couples & famililes

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

140940952.name: Wow
140940952.author: a TripAdvisor user
140940952.reviewBody: Tlaquepaque is a wonderful place with History, Sites, Shopping & great Restaurants. So much to see and do definitly not a 1 day trip..

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

138259387.name: Art and artesania
138259387.author: a TripAdvisor user
138259387.reviewBody: Hosts the National Concurso of Ceramics and many other art and artisan events each year and has a significant collection of the prize-winning pieces from past concursos.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

127416789.name: Historic Architecture
127416789.author: a TripAdvisor user
127416789.reviewBody: Lots of beautiful buildings, plazas, fountains, public art, great for people watching, photo opps and history buffs.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

123265660.name: Centro Cultural
123265660.author: a TripAdvisor user
123265660.reviewBody: Lots of history if you take the time to read the plaques and find out what/who is represented.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

115326681.name: Central Guadalajara
115326681.author: a TripAdvisor user
115326681.reviewBody: The construction and architecture of the buildings were incredible.  We took lots of pictures of the government buildings and saw lots of beauty.  We felt safe as we visited our daughter and husband who are doing mission work for 2 1/2 years in Guadalajara.  It did calm our fears as we visited and stayed away from the border cities.  We feel they are safe where they are at.  Speaking Spanish or being with someone is a real plus as many smaller places don\'t have any English speaking people. We had a great time and will plan to do it again.\nWe also went to Guanajuato which was so impressive.  It felt like a European town and had such beauty with the all different colored houses on the hillside along with the incredible architecture and color of the town itself.  They have a Funicular and we rode that to the top of the mountain.  It had such class, good restaurants and beauty.  It\'s a must see.

address.streetAddress: Calle Donato Guerra 160 Col. Tlaquepaque Centro

669223665.name: Beautiful church with fantastic carvings and chandeliers inside.
669223665.author: a TripAdvisor user
669223665.reviewBody: One of two historic churches bordering Jardi\u00edn Hidalgo, I thought this was more lavishly decorated than the other. Inside was decorated beautifully. This is definitely worth a visit if you find yourself in Tlaquepaque Centro.

itemReviewed.name: Santuario de Nuestra Senora de la Soledad

567573552.name: The Real Deal
567573552.author: a TripAdvisor user
567573552.reviewBody: Just off of Plaza Hidalgo, this gorgeous church actually feels like a spiritual place, rather than a Spanish bragging point, emphasized by the lofty name.  The bright cream-colored turrets thrust over the neighborhood with a cupola behind and are real eye catchers sitting atop simple bare stone.  The interior itself is standard cathedral.  Just drink in the building.

itemReviewed.name: Santuario de Nuestra Senora de la Soledad

669223052.name: A magnificent historical church in the quaint and artsy Tlaquepaque.
669223052.author: a TripAdvisor user
669223052.reviewBody: This is one of two main churches right next to each other bordering the main square in Centro, Jard\u00edn Hidalgo. It is absolutely worth seeing as it is an excellent example of a smaller historic Catholic church.

667968961.name: Nice, imposing church
667968961.author: a TripAdvisor user
667968961.reviewBody: The church is nice and imposing,  situated in Tlaquepaque, close to Jardin Hidalgo. Is a nice place that you cannot miss.

654582190.name: Gorgeous church in the heart of Tlaquepaque
654582190.author: a TripAdvisor user
654582190.reviewBody: This church is a standout with its white facade and beautiful statutes.   It is literally adjacent to another extraordinary church.  Be sure to give both churches equal time; you will be glad you did.

567573888.name: Interesting Pillars
567573888.author: a TripAdvisor user
567573888.reviewBody: This cathedral suffers by being right next to The Sanctuary of Solitude which I found spectacular.  This one is mainly just pretty.  Inside the sanctuary, the pews are separated by columns and arches, quite unusual for Mexico.  Somehow it brought a mental image of the famous Mesquite de Cordoba.  This oddity brought it from a three to a four for me.

557990053.name: Nice
557990053.author: a TripAdvisor user
557990053.reviewBody: This lovely church was built starting in 1670 and construction lasted almost 150 years.  It\'s patron saint is Pedro and a large portrait of the saint is found inside the church.  The altar features the Lady of the Guadalupe.  There was a funeral when we were there and this beautiful old car served as a hearse.

533183258.name: Beautiful church
533183258.author: a TripAdvisor user
533183258.reviewBody: Beautiful church and gardens, worth looking into close to the main square. Feels very European and quite old

494566296.name: Nice Church
494566296.author: a TripAdvisor user
494566296.reviewBody: In a area of marvelous churches this is more on the average side.\n\nThe area outside is full of attractions and lots of people walking around.

488483590.name: Nice church
488483590.author: a TripAdvisor user
488483590.reviewBody: This church sits right next to a nice park where you can hear music and relax. We stopped by this church for our first time March 2017 and were impressed how nice of a church it is.

196778230.name: Beautiful place
196778230.author: a TripAdvisor user
196778230.reviewBody: It is a beautiful place. It is a Catholic Church building that has a lot of art and history. I visited the place many times, with family, with friends from other countries and they really enjoyed it. \n

169652425.name: Sister to the Vatican
169652425.author: a TripAdvisor user
169652425.reviewBody: A very old religious building. Simple and beautiful at the same time.  Closes at lunch time.  Related to Saint Peter\'s in Rome for centuries. Beautiful plazas and pdestrian \u00e1reas arround. Accesible.

123268799.name: Parroquia
123268799.author: a TripAdvisor user
123268799.reviewBody: Nice area to relax, eat, drink and listen to Mariachi music.

670751547.name: if you are serious about buying tequila, go to Walmart
670751547.author: a TripAdvisor user
670751547.reviewBody: no kidding. best prices, good selection. Don\'t forget to put it in your checked bag. Duty free is an option but watch out that they bag it right if you have a connecting flight. There is a special bag for the US. they did not use it for me and mine was seized in Houston.  ; (

631387514.name: converted me to a Tequila drinker
631387514.author: a TripAdvisor user
631387514.reviewBody: This shop has an amazing selection of tequila and mezcal. they were friendly and beyond attentive. they gave us some great education and taught us how to savour the tequila. I was reluctant at first and they convinced me. They treat the Tequila like a fine wine and have an amazing selection of top quality Tequila & Mezcal. I would go back in a heartbeat.

591291021.name: Great Place to Buy Tequila/Mezcal
591291021.author: a TripAdvisor user
591291021.reviewBody:
My wife and I stopped by Tlaquepaque for a few hours while on a layover. We ventured in to La Cata while walking around Tlaquepaque. The store is nicely decorated and has many fine tequilas and mezcales available for purchase.

Since we were on a layover our bags were checked and we couldn’t purchase a full-size bottle of tequila. The sales associate showed us some of the smaller bottles of tequila and allowed us to taste the varietals we were considering purchasing.  

The tequilas we tried were amazing and purchased a set of Adictivo Tequila in mini-bottles. I was able to put the set of mini bottles in my backpack and clear security with no problems. Shopping at La Cata was a great experience and we will definitely be back whenever we return to the area.

503894211.name: A complete family day outdoors.
503894211.author: a TripAdvisor user
503894211.reviewBody:
This place is perfect for a whole day of sport activities and picnic with the childrens.

It's a big park has parking lot, the cost of entry it's cheap and offer facilities like tables, bbq grilles, toilets, trampoline rental, bike rental and food stalls. The best if your children can ride a bike has a bike track available and also a saketpark.

Everything, is not a good as new, but is in OK conditions. Go to Parque Montenegro and enjoy your day.

557430573.name: Stole our money and refused refund
557430573.author: a TripAdvisor user
557430573.reviewBody: What a scam. There are some lovely pieces in this gallery, and after meeting one of the artists and seeing his exhibit, we chose a wonderful painting titled "Toro" by artist Cesar Plascencia. We paid 20,000 pesos ($1,000 USD) including 1,200 pesos for shipping to the United States. I followed up regularly for months, and the gallery manager kept telling me it was "en route." After 6 months they said they lost it, and the artist was going to remake the painting. Then they said it was ready and being shipped. Then they stopped answering my emails. It has been more than one year, so I can no longer dispute the charge with my bank, and they have effectively stolen $1,000 from me. I thought I could trust them, but obviously they have no interest in maintaining their facade as a reputable gallery. Very disappointing.

494883911.name: Great Galeria
494883911.author: a TripAdvisor user
494883911.reviewBody:
Tlaquepaque is a must if you like Art and this gallery deserves to be called an Art Gallery.

Very charmy with a touch of sophistication.

Has to be seem.

351936058.name: Issues
351936058.author: a TripAdvisor user
351936058.reviewBody: There ae some really beautiful pieces - originals, but also mass produced reproductions... the day we went in the person working never got off of their cell phone to even say hello.

334461649.name: Treasures from Mexican Artists
334461649.author: a TripAdvisor user
334461649.reviewBody:
If you love to look at art and you find yourself in Guadalajara, 25 minutes from Tlaquepaque, MX, give yourself a treat and visit Alejandro's Galeria.  From the moment you enter, you will see and feel what is so special about this gallery.  The works of artists who have a different "oeuvre" greet you upon entering this lovely gallery just off Avenida Independencia.  Alejandro has a talent for finding artists who observe more than what the eye can see.  And, prices are more than fair and reasonable. 

We have been to Tlaquepaque twice and have now purchased five works of art: four created by Cesar Plasencia.  Cesar has exhibited internationally and will take part in an exposition in Mexico City in January.  

Do yourself a favor and take the time to enjoy the many works of art while getting to know Alejandro and the artists whose works populate his gallery.

250270580.name: An absolute MUST
250270580.author: a TripAdvisor user
250270580.reviewBody: So much incredible talent- such beauty in so many forms. I look forward to seeing what is new next visit

248869887.name: First Class Art
248869887.author: a TripAdvisor user
248869887.reviewBody: Alejandro Calvillo is the agent for a most amazingly talented artist - Cesar Placencia.  We have bought four paintings done by Cesar now, which we love and are continually complimented on.  Cesar has an extreme amount of talent and can create anything from a photo.  We were so happy to see that Alejandro had now opened up a gallery and, not only has paintings, but so many incredible pieces of furniture that are unique, one of a kind pieces.  If in Tlaquepaque, this is a do not miss this gallery, if even just to have a look.  The owner Alejandro is friendly, charming and will give you a most warm welcome.

627295757.name: Hidden gem
627295757.author: a TripAdvisor user
627295757.reviewBody: I have been visiting Arcangel in his crowded shop for at least 10 years.  It never fails to amaze me!  Sometimes, he is not open because he has a house call to make, but he always returns.  I was recently there and took some pictures so that everyone can see what a treasure this shop is!  Arcangel is knowledgeable about what he sells- the families and the styles of ceramicists in the area.  He loves paintings and religious art- and i have purchased five paintings from him in recent years.  \nThis is not a shop for kids as it is quite small.  I often visit several days before i buy, because I miss some wonderful thing I cannot live without.  Whether jewelry, fine art, retablos, or ceramics he has an excellent and ever changing selection.  Finally he has decided to put his shop up on the web for everyone to visit.

507940875.name: Beautiful house to look at, BUT nothing else to see.
507940875.author: a TripAdvisor user
507940875.reviewBody: This old house has a beautiful architecture, a lovely patio and it has a beautiful garden worth a towering old tree that is beautiful. The drawback is that it is privately owned, so it is not open to the public. If you have a chance to go inside the patio, YOU MUST. But as far as any sight seeing or tour inside, there is non. If you are keen on getting to know the inside of the house (the patio), maybe the people at the tourism office of tlaquepaque can help you out.

591347931.name: Some Sweets, Short Service, Lots of Tequila
591347931.author: a TripAdvisor user
591347931.reviewBody: My wife and I stopped by here while visiting the area. Although there were many different types of candies, they seem outnumbered by the amount of tequila they sell. They offer the candies for decent prices. The young girls working there were more interested in talking to each other than helping customers. Whatever the case, it\u2019s still worth dropping by to pick up some candy or a bottle of tequila.

562575850.name: Absolutely Best Store for Tequila
562575850.author: a TripAdvisor user
562575850.reviewBody: Selection is separated into styles.  Staff is young and not knowledgeable.  Know exactly what you want before going in.  Down the street 3 doors away or so there is another store.  The owner or manager there is VERY knowledgeable.  His selection is okay and he will allow sampling. I knew what I wanted and the price was better at Nuestros.

562218717.name: The largest selection of Tequila
562218717.author: a TripAdvisor user
562218717.reviewBody: I am not an expert on Tequila, but this store is neat to walk through. We bought a Tequila brand that we were familiar with called Don Ramon Especial. It was the premium brand and we loved it. I only wished that it was sold in other stores also because we would have bought another bottle to take home. It was too far to drive back to this store from our hotel.

494881618.name: Not Impressed
494881618.author: a TripAdvisor user
494881618.reviewBody: I am not a Tequila guy so I was not impressed by the enormous amount of different bottles.\n\nI have to say also that I was not impressed either by their selection of candies, most of them taste the same and looks like an industrial stuff not handcrafted (artesanal) as they claimed to be.

488482256.name: Nice shop, but the staff...
488482256.author: a TripAdvisor user
488482256.reviewBody: I have been to this place each time I visit Tlaquepaque and always find something to take home ( very nice shopping ), but the employees seem to hate the tourist that come to shop. Go figure.

473475441.name: Great Tequila Shop.. Not So Great Staff
473475441.author: a TripAdvisor user
473475441.reviewBody:
Went here while on a "Tapatio (Red Bus) Tour". Store is located within sight of one of the tour stops which last about 40 minutes. This shop has the most tequilas I have ever seen in one location. However, you are unfortunately pretty much on your own to navigate the vast selections. 

I bought a 750ml 2Yr Old 100% Agave Tequila for 260MXN (US$15). I won't know if I made a decent purchase as I was never assisted by the staff except to pay for it. 

Either way I doubt you can go to wrong shopping here. Tequila!

459406319.name: So Much Tequila. So Little Time
459406319.author: a TripAdvisor user
459406319.reviewBody: If you want to find an unusual bottle of tequila - this is the place.  They boast over 1,800 bottles! Whether you are buying a bottle or not, it is worth it to stop in this store.  It is amazing!  They also have some miniature bottles of tequila that are fun to collect or to give as gifts.  You can also shop for Mexican candies and food gifts.

447140028.name: Best selection of tequilas!
447140028.author: a TripAdvisor user
447140028.reviewBody: This has the widest selection of tequila available anywhere. This is my go-to place if I\'m looking for a tequila that\'s unique and hard to find. There is also a selection of traditional Mexican treats that make excellent gifts.

425402117.name: The staff here seriously look like they are hating life
425402117.author: a TripAdvisor user
425402117.reviewBody: Great assortment of goods if you can ignore the apathetic staff that seem to think they\'re doing you a favour by being there.

384394678.name: Lots and lots of sweets
384394678.author: a TripAdvisor user
384394678.reviewBody: A good stop to check out different assortment of candies, chocolates, fruit pastes, honeys, etc. It is very well stocked and fun to visit.

327031470.name: Fun Stop
327031470.author: a TripAdvisor user
327031470.reviewBody: Great place to look around and come across something random, or not so random. Great supply of Tequila and candy. Staff is very friendly and will let you have samples of certain brands. They are all reasonably, fairly priced and worth buying here VS at the airport. Just ask them to double wrap it and remember pack it in your checked bag, don\'t take it in your carry on. \n\nHappy Shopping!

316331786.name: A Must Stop
316331786.author: a TripAdvisor user
316331786.reviewBody: Not sure we can count the number of times we have shopped this store or the number of bottles purchased there?  By far the best selection of any store we have vsited and that would include shops in Tequila.  Fair prices.

287612603.name: If you can\'t find a Tequila here that you like you will never find it
287612603.author: a TripAdvisor user
287612603.reviewBody: Not all bottles that you see are available, but I must admit, they must have the best selection of Tequilas in the world.  This is an experience.

181320536.name: Go even if you don\'t eat a lot of sweets!
181320536.author: a TripAdvisor user
181320536.reviewBody: A local friend recommended we make a trip through Tlaqapaque to check out the tequilas. Wow! There are a few brands and bottles here you\'ll see elsewhere but mostly small production and souvenir bottles of tequila not seen anywhere else and certainly the largest selection in one place. I didn\'t see this variety even in Tequila. Equally outstanding are the candies; a fabulous selection and very thoughtful range of sizes. You can get just a small treat or pre-packaged size for the whole house. The arrayan jellies and a wonderful local treat to try, with natural tartness. Hubby\'s favorite is the tamarind with chile.  Buy all you think you\'ll need for yourselves and souvenirs. Then pick up 1/2 dozen or more small bags of sweets for all the souvenirs you\'ll wish you brought back. Not expensive and so nice to share something so local. Friendly family owned and operated.

384385594.name: Not as hoped for.
384385594.author: a TripAdvisor user
384385594.reviewBody: I was not impressed by this gallery since I visited other galleries and the mercados both in Tlequepaque and Guadalajara, I felt this gallery did not offer anything different.

address.streetAddress: Calle Francisco de Miranda 31 a Frente Al Hotel Casa Campos

646599922.name: Tasty and Informative
646599922.author: a TripAdvisor user
646599922.reviewBody: I love Mexican food and drink, and now understand more about both. Our guide, Aamaya, was very professional and a fount of knowledge. We started in the market with an introduction to many of the ingredients we would eventually taste. The selection of dishes and drinks was perfectly varied, as were the stops along the way. This was a high quality experience and a great way to enjoy Tlaquepaque.

645862705.name: Tlaquepaque Food and Tequila Tasting Tour
645862705.author: a TripAdvisor user
645862705.reviewBody: Five of us enjoyed a wonderful introduction to local Mexican dishes and tequila offered by Mexican Food Tour.  The food and tequila were delicious. The guide is very knowledgeable about the food and drink plus the the history of the area. You will not be disappointed!

645800677.name: An Historical and Gastronomic Delight
645800677.author: a TripAdvisor user
645800677.reviewBody: This is a combination history-and-culinary tour. We cannot recommend Amaya and the tour highly enough. The selection of dishes and drinks were well-balanced and complementary. Your appreciation of Mexican history will increase appreciably through the presentation of the cuisine from market to murals. If you will spend a day in Tlaquepaque, be sure to include this treasure.

604054175.name: Beyond food...
604054175.author: a TripAdvisor user
604054175.reviewBody: So it\u2019s just normal to want to save some money while traveling but... if you have the chance to book this tour, you\u2019ll be rewarded with a class of history of both the place and the food!!! It is quite amazing to understand how this flavors were put together in which part of the Mexican history and by whom! And wait... the art and streets and houses you walk by are also part of this tour! That is why I give it a great review and name it... beyond food!\nThank you Amaya, you made our day special!

578184880.name: Food and culture in one
578184880.author: a TripAdvisor user
578184880.reviewBody: Great tour with Amaya, i was the only one so ended up being a private tour! Ate so much great food while learning so much about the history of the area. I highly recommend if you have a free afternoon.

568265032.name: BEST tour for a Guadalajara vacation
568265032.author: a TripAdvisor user
568265032.reviewBody: I cannot recommend this tour enough!  I do quite a bit of traveling and have done many food tours all over the world (France, USA, Cambodia, etc), and this was by far my BEST experience because of my guide\'s knowledge and passion for food, drink, and history.  It was incredible!!  The food is off the charts delicious, and it\'s pretty cool knowing the story behind the food being eaten.  For what is offered, the price is actually a bargain considering you\'re set for lunch and dinner (it\'s A TON of food -- do not eat breakfast!) and the knowledge gained is awesome. Two thumbs up!\nMuchisimas gracias Amaya -- fue increible tu tour!

559296648.name: Great Tasting Tour
559296648.author: a TripAdvisor user
559296648.reviewBody: Amaya greeted the two of us with a big smile.  With no other tour members, we enjoyed a private guided journey through the wonderful foods of Jalisco, Mexico. Her knowledge and passion for the local specialties was obvious. She speaks English very well and clearly. You will be very pleased to spend time with her.

554291030.name: Fabulous food tour
554291030.author: a TripAdvisor user
554291030.reviewBody: This is a wonderful walking tour! It lasted 41/2 hours- during that time we tasted local delicacies (food and drinks) at many restaurants, learned about local history, and even had a tequila tasting at the shop of a distillery downtown. Our expert guide, Amaya, is a food scientist and is interesting, knowledgeable and speaks excellent English. This tour should not be missed!

539525723.name: Great way to get to know a town and its people!
539525723.author: a TripAdvisor user
539525723.reviewBody: Amaya did a great job today.  We ate and drank our way around town...from Cazuela to drink to Chile en Nogada...all yummy and just enough history and culture to be remembered.  Highly recommend!

514524405.name: Awesome Tour Great food for Vegans too!
514524405.author: a TripAdvisor user
514524405.reviewBody: Loved the tour, informative, pleasant at a nice pace and the food choices were great. Amaya is a great guide.\nI am vegan and they accommodated my no animal products restrictions, the food I was served was delicious and so were the drinks! My mom is not vegan and she tasted all the traditional dishes and was also very happy with the food quality and portions.  Thank you again, I highly recommend it for things to do in Tlaquepaque.

511597572.name: Getting to know Tlaquepacque
511597572.author: a TripAdvisor user
511597572.reviewBody: Amaya Cevallos was the perfect guide for me, a Spanish language student. My Spanish teacher, Gina Covello of Habla Language Services, booked this tour for us. Amaya took us to wonderful restaurants, the huge marketplace, a sweet shop and a tequila shop. The tour was conducted totally in Spanish (at my teacher\'s request) at a level I could understand. And when I could not understand, Amaya took the time to re-explain in Spanish and English if necessary.

494097006.name: Lovely tour with Amaya through charming Tlaquepaque!
494097006.author: a TripAdvisor user
494097006.reviewBody:
My elderly mother (80) and I (48) took this tour with Amaya on June 13, 2017 and we had an absolutely wonderful time! Amaya is easily one of the most knowledgeable and patient tour guides we've ever met and she guided us to our appreciation of what makes this area of Guadalajara so unique. 

The food presented are in just the right portions so that you can enjoy the different flavours without feeling stuffed. The pace of the tour, even for older people like my mother and I, is very well moderated by Amaya so that you aren't rushing from place-to-place like you do in other tours.  Because my mother and I were running rather late meeting with Amaya at the starting point (La Mata Tinta) from our Centro Historico hotel (traffic was insane!), I was very anxious and called up Amaya.  But Amaya kindly assured me she would wait and directed our taxi driver to the best means of getting us there. Thanks Amaya!

So if you're planning to visit GDL or have a day to spare, you MUST do this Tlaquepaque tour! Book with these people and get yourself out of the busy and hectic scene of the busier areas in Guadalajara, so you can appreciate some of the best parts of Mexico and it's wonderful culture. You will most likely have Amaya as your guide so rest assured that you will be in excellent company as you walk through this lovely area.

463288994.name: Well versed guide
463288994.author: a TripAdvisor user
463288994.reviewBody: I suspect that Amaya is the principal guide on this tour. The tour was well paced and informative. The food choices offered a worthwhile variety and tastes. Highly recommended for  any foodies.

440029520.name: This is a food AND tequila tour!
440029520.author: a TripAdvisor user
440029520.reviewBody: First of all, I don\'t know how much Amaya gets paid but she deserves a raise!! She was absolutely amazing and knowledgeable and friendly. I usually mentally check out on historical facts but she even kept my attention when talking about different types of local beans...beans??!? The tour goes like this: you learn a little then you eat/drink a little. It was great. The food was good and the tequila was just right. I learned so much about Mexican history, gastronomy, and how seriously people from Jalisco are about tequila. I would recommend this tour to anyone and everyone.

439911361.name: Get to know the food of Tlaquepaque and Guadalajara!
439911361.author: a TripAdvisor user
439911361.reviewBody: After some comunications hiccups (I had some problems reaching them to confirm the tour on the following day, but eventually they managed to contact me some hours before it to confirm it), I started this solo trip. My expectations for it were somewhat low, as I found them while "googling" it in tripadvisor and due to the hiccups, I didn\'t know what to expect. But the end result was well worth it. In the tour, done entirely in good english, you get to know the lovely city of Tlaquepaque, a city part of Guadalajara metropolitan area, and its food. The guide will tell you A LOT of the history of the city and of mexico, including paintings, murals, important building and people, while matching step by step with good food and tequila tasting. In the end you have that lovely sense of accomplishment, after getting to know a good variety of local dishes, good tequila and margarita, as well as the history of the place.\n\nIf you have a couple hours to spare, I highly recommend you give it a go. If you are staying in guadalajara you will need a taxi or a bus and some good walking to get to tlaquepaque, but it is well worth it. It is also a good opportunity to buy a nice tequila bottle home if that tickles your fancy, as you pass many very good shops of the kind. Well-Recommended!

437652620.name: Highly Recommended
437652620.author: a TripAdvisor user
437652620.reviewBody: We both were very pleased with Amaya\'s strolling tour to eating and drinking spots with much fascinating information about regional food, drink, history, and culture.

383573216.name: Best introduction to Tlaquepaque food and culture!
383573216.author: a TripAdvisor user
383573216.reviewBody: Amaya really knows her stuff, in English or Spanish (maybe even Duetsch).  She covers local staples, history, and specialty foods in a friendly and interesting way.  Not only did we get marvelous full servings of a carefully selected variety of local foods, we also got several specialty drinks, a tequila sampling and education, chocolate and frozen treats, and a chance to see some local gems that we had previously overlooked.  She includes a map with the foods listed, so if you fall in love with a place or a dish (and you will!), you can go back and find it again.  I immediately sent my friends over and I highly recommend it for you too!  **tip: with advance notice, she will attempt to accomodate groups outside of the regular tour times, so we were able to join her for dinner instead of lunch.**

383286986.name: Amazing!
383286986.author: a TripAdvisor user
383286986.reviewBody: Such a wonderful experience. I\'ve been staying in Tlaquepaque for two weeks and this tour helped me venture further into the town\'s culture and cuisine. Well worth the price for delicious, authentic food and interesting history tid bits. Do this tour!

371851867.name: Best tour ever!
371851867.author: a TripAdvisor user
371851867.reviewBody: Amaya kept our party of four entertained and informed for nearly four hours while introducing us to many examples of the fine cuisine of Jalisco and Guadalajara. It was a pleasure and the highlight of our visit to the area.

355417943.name: Wonderful tastings of traditional fare
355417943.author: a TripAdvisor user
355417943.reviewBody: Amaya provided my friend & I with a wonderful tour of 9 different restaurants/shops for tastings of chile nogada, tequila, chocolates, and other amazing dishes.  She also provided some great historical information and was willing to spend extra time with us.  \nHighly recommend this tour, especially with Amaya.

354732413.name: Wonderful!!! Thank you Amaya!
354732413.author: a TripAdvisor user
354732413.reviewBody: We had a wonderful tour with Amaya.  She is amazing.  It was my dad, wife and I only on the tour.  So we had a personal tour guide. :)  We got some to try many local treats, plus some great history and cultural lessons.  We had such a great day with Amaya we went back to Tlaquepaque for a second day.

350279897.name: Excellent food tour with Amaya
350279897.author: a TripAdvisor user
350279897.reviewBody: I\'ve been on lots of food tours around the world, and this tour around Tlaquepaque was top notch.  The guide, Amaya, was charming and knowledgeable and the tour included some history and culture in addition to the tasty treats.    The foods tasted were really excellent versions of the local cuisine - for example, the torta ahogada (drowned sandwich) was the best version of the three I tasted subsequently.   This was a really well researched and nicely rounded tour of a beautiful neighborhood in Guadalajara.   Highly recommended.

342230559.name: The smartest thing we did!
342230559.author: a TripAdvisor user
342230559.reviewBody: We have been to Tlaquepaque several times, but never really dug in to all there was to do. I would recommend using her the first day you are there. Then you will have all sorts of ideas about where you want to eat, drink, and visit the rest of your time there. Amaya was great! Food was exceptional and most of it was something we would never know to ask about or order on our own. It really opened up our eyes and stuffed our stomachs! Pace yourself and do this!

321014919.name: Best Day of our trip
321014919.author: a TripAdvisor user
321014919.reviewBody: My wife and I had Amaya all to ourselves as we were the only two on our tour last week.  It was a really wonderful 3 hours or so of wandering around beautiful Tlaquepaque and being able to hear about not just the food but also the history of the town and of Mexico.  Amaya is just great!  Vey knowledgeable and very patient with questions.  The itinerary is a good mix of different places - restaurants, the local market, candy store, chocolate shop, etc.  And the food was excellent!  Do NOT eat much before you start on this tour - there is more than enough food for a full meal - in fact we didn\'t eat dinner that night.  I particularly enjoyed the drinks we had at each location - mostly fruit juice "cocktails" that are traditional for Mexico or the state of Jalisco - but they were so tasty and enjoyable.  This was our first visit to Guadalajara and Tlaquepaque and living in Phoenix we are just a short two hour flight away so will definitely be returning to enjoy more of the food, culture and drinks.  I very highly recommend this tour even if you are more familiar with the area and the food - it is such an enjoyable way to spend a few hours.

320370250.name: Discovering Tlaquepaque Through Food & History
320370250.author: a TripAdvisor user
320370250.reviewBody:
My family & I took this tour with Amaya last week & I have to say it was the best time. I have been to Tlaquepaque many times, having gone with family that lives there only to shop & walk around (and of course listen to Mariachis, drink, and eat). When I told them I was planning on doing a food tour they were very suspicious of it and very much against it. Apparently food tours aren't as well known there as they are here in NYC. After much push back (and believe me there was quite a bit), my brother, his girlfriend, my husband, and I met with Amaya for our tour. There was a sanitation workers strike, so the otherwise picturesque main street of Tlaquepaque was blocked by very fragrant garbage trucks..our poor guide Amaya felt so bad about it but we're from NYC and used to worse smells! LOL It didn't bother us in the least nor did the manifestations at the government building. For us, this was just a new experience and we were happy to be a part of it. 

So let's get down to business... 8 tastings & 9 different locations visited! We ate a lot! And did I mention that beverages were also included? YES! To preserve the intellectual property of the tour, I won't name every place we went to because you definitely have to experience it for yourself. Amaya did a beautiful job of planning this itinerary that weaved us through the streets of Tlaqupaque, balancing out food and drink tastings artfully, all the while giving us history of the area. We talked about art, architecture, and of course the politics of food culture in Mexico. We visited a market to learn more about traditional ingredients in Mexican cuisine and boy did we learn new stuff! Having grown up with a big Mexican influence, it was great being able to learn new things and learn more about my heritage. Our first tasting was the way every tasting should start.. tacos & tequila! Ok, it wasn't straight tequila, it was a drink called a "casuela" and it is literally a bowl of grapefruit soda, grapefruits, limes, oranges, and a fruit called lima with salt and the "optional" shot of tequila on the side to add to it. Uhm, tequila is not optional in our family... so we poured the entire shot in the bowl.. yes, at 11:30am. It's 5 o'clock somewhere right? Again, having been to Mexico before I had never seen this drink and was very happy to have discovered it. The taco de birria (or shredded goat stew) was tasty and like all the other servings, sauces-spicy and not- are served on the side so that each person can gauge what is best for them. This place offered seating, bathrooms, and you are there for a good amount of time. 

Our next tasting led us to a "neveria" or an ice cream shop where we tried something else I had never tried before, called "tejuino" which is lime sherbert mixed with water, ground corn, and salt.  It is definitely an acquired taste but if you like salty and sour then this is for you. 

From here we moved on and talked history and art, slowly walking through the streets of Tlaquepaque, never feeling rushed. Amaya was so patient with us stopping to take pictures even though we were on a food schedule & had places to be. 

The next tasting was also one I had never had but had always wanted to. This tasting was an actual full portion and I wanted more after I was done. The "chile en nogada" was hands down one of my favorite tastings on this tour. It was the perfect balance of sweet and salty with some nuttiness thrown in for good texture. Delicious! Again, here is another opportunity to sit, relax, and use the restroom. Oh and we also had a drink here  called "horchata rosada" which was made with coconut milk & grendadine... usually not an horchata fan but this one turned me into one. This is a pretty filling tasting and it's only #3 so what better way to digest and make room for more than by sipping on some tequilas somewhere else! We sampled a variety of tequilas and liqueurs (I did tell you we don't shy away from drinking) and again Amaya was incredibly patient while some of us shopped and the rest of us drank. ;) 

Our next tasting led us to yet another item I had never tried before, the "torta ahogada". This literally translates into drowned sandwich so the idea is to drown your sandwich in the tomato sauce and spicy sauce provided. Of course the sauces were on the side and you can either dip the sandwich in them or pour them over it. I tried the dipping method, but let's face it, i like to get messy so I poured the sauce all over and yes it was indeed messy! But totally worth it. I would do it again and again. We also had a delicious agua fresca made with mint and lime juice and of course water. 
Yet another chance to sit, relax, and use the restroom. 

Already filling up, onward we went to an artisanal choclaterie where we tasted a beverage called "tascalate" made with cacao, corn, water, annatto, and some other ingredients I can't recall. This was a lovely little drink. And the best part was not one person in my extended family had heard of it and now want to go try it! HA! We also sampled tasty chocolates here as well. 

Almost done with the tour, we still had a couple of places to visit. And so we went to another place to try Mexico City style quesadillas with a mixed berry margarita & finally to a tradtional candy shop selling home made candies, Mexican egg nog "rompope" and so much more. 

Overall we had the best time with Amaya. As a guide she is very knowledgable, friendly, patient... everything you want a guide to be. It felt as if we were hanging out with a friend instead of a tour guide. It is very clear that she has a huge love and passion for Tlaquepaque and for guiding overall. 

Note: What I have not said is that I am a NYC food tour guide and went on this tour 1. because I am a foodie 2. because I wanted to learn more about Tlaquepaque from someone other than my family 3. because I wanted to see how other guides work. I did in fact mention to Amaya at the end of the tour that I was a guide for full disclosure. As a guide, I can recognize when someone is working just to make money and when someone is doing this because they thrive from it and love it. Amaya very clearly thrives from it and loves what she does. I would take her tour(s) again and seeing her in action made me realize why I do what I do. So thank you Amaya for a wonderful time and for reminding me that the places where we live and come from should be shared with others with lots of love. Gracias!!!

306810061.name: Wonderful tour on a layover!
306810061.author: a TripAdvisor user
306810061.reviewBody: Another Flt. Attdnt. and I took this tour on one of our layovers.  It was so much fun!  Food was excellent and our guide was awesome.  I really appreciate the culinary information as well as the guided tour of the city.  I would recommend the tour to anyone!  And I have!

301289745.name: Great tour
301289745.author: a TripAdvisor user
301289745.reviewBody: Very well thought out. Our guide was very knowledgeable. I would recommend this to anyone interested in food and culture.

289686986.name: An amazingly great way to spend a day getting to know Tlaquepaque and Mexican food.
289686986.author: a TripAdvisor user
289686986.reviewBody: We travel the world and have found that one of the best ways to get to know a place is through it\'s food!  This food tour did not disappoint! The food and drink options were ample and very tasty! Eat a small breakfast and come with an appetite!\n\nAmaya was knowledgeable, personable and interesting. Food was the focus of the tour, but it was also such a great lesson in culture, history, gastronomy and geography. The choices of dishes and drinks were well thought out and well paced. The tour map with restaurant names and names of dishes was just another example of how well thought out the entire experience was. Highly recommended.

280901788.name: THE best experience
280901788.author: a TripAdvisor user
280901788.reviewBody: I spent a week in Tlaquepaque and after touring the shops, I ran out of things to do.  The Tlaquepaque Food Tour opened my eyes to a world of delights that I had been walking right by!  I travel a lot, and I can honestly say that this tour was one of the best experiences I have ever had.  Amaya, the guide, with her perfect English, explained far more than food and culture.  She pointed out historical sites and offered a deeper context  to this rich environment.  Fantastic food and beverage offerings.  MORE than a meal.  Come hungry.

279953864.name: Awesome food tour
279953864.author: a TripAdvisor user
279953864.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the tour. The food was different,  authentic, and delicious all in one. Our guide Amaya was wonderful. She is very knowledgeable and was able to give us the history of the locations we stopped at, as well as an explanation of the foods we were eating. All portions are pretty good size. Grenadine Horchata and Mint Limeade were my two favorite drinks! \nTequila tasting is available for adults and a stop at a candy shop is perfect for the kids. Highly recommended.

266141920.name: Outstanding
266141920.author: a TripAdvisor user
266141920.reviewBody: Although I have been to Tlaquepaque many times, this tour was a refreshing visit in which I learned many new aspects of the area. Amaya was very knowledgeable and very helpful (her professional training is that of a food technologist); the tour was listed for three hours but she actually spent considerably longer with us. I was introduced to many foods I had not previously experienced, and the quality was uniformly excellent (having apparently been personally chosen by Amaya herself). I have been on food tours in several areas of the world, and this was easily one of the best.

261521303.name: Wonderful way to learn about Tlaquepaque
261521303.author: a TripAdvisor user
261521303.reviewBody: Amaya, owner and guide, is very knowledgeable and personable.  The hours we spent with her exploring the history and gastronomy of Tlaquepaque were extremely enjoyable and her tour is recommended whole heartedly.

261073320.name: Great Way to Be Introduced to Guadalajara
261073320.author: a TripAdvisor user
261073320.reviewBody:
Not only did our guide & owner, Amaya, provide us with great directions, because it threatened rain that day, she brought ponchos!

That was just the start of a great tour which included history, the main market so you could see what many of the ingredients were to be, as well as many stops to taste everything from main courses to desert.  

In addition, she also indicated other attractions in Tlaquepaque, an adjacent suburb of Guadalajara, as well as in the state of Jalisco.  

Amaya is not only knowledgeable, but very personable which made for a wonderful tour.

260794744.name: Highly recommended, especially if you are a foodie.
260794744.author: a TripAdvisor user
260794744.reviewBody:
My only regret is that I didn't go earlier in the week, but it all worked out.  I was the only client on the tour, so it was a special treat.

Amaya is a great guide.  I was there for spanish school and she conducted the tour in Spanish at my request.  

We had a great walk through the city and tasted the best that Tlaquepaque has to offer.

There is way too much food, but I was happily eating my leftovers for several days.

255405388.name: Food and History Walking Tour
255405388.author: a TripAdvisor user
255405388.reviewBody: I have stayed in Tlaquepaque several times.  Am familiar with the area.  However, Amalya showed me much that I had not discovered on my own.  We started with the market where I learned the history of many of the fruits, vegetables and the local bread.  Visited several restaurants and stores where I could sample local food and drink which I would not dare to try on my own.  Many of these were just strange names on a menu...and now they are special treats.  I highly recommend this tour.

251145748.name: Wonderful.  Amaya is the Best!
251145748.author: a TripAdvisor user
251145748.reviewBody: We loved walking, touring, tasting, drinking and taking in the culture of Tlaquepaque.  It was fun and informative.  Highly recommend it to travelers.

241902637.name: Exceeds Expectations!!!
241902637.author: a TripAdvisor user
241902637.reviewBody: We had an amazing day with Amaya exploring the food and culture of Tlaquepaque.  She is very knowledgable not only about the food of the region but the local history as well.  We started our day at the local market which was amazing.  We sampled an array of local food and drink including Cazuela--sort of a local sangria that is made with Tequila instead of wine--and a goat meat taco.  This was follwed by a corn based "smoothie" that was sweet and refreshing.  Our favorite was the Chile en Negada--a poblano pepper stuffed with beef, sausage, fruit and pecans and topped with a pecan gravy, crushed pecans, pomegranates, and parsley.  This was followed by a refreshing drink made from lime juice, sugar and peppermint that accompanied a wonderful sandwich whose name translates to drunken sandwich--a hard roll made ONLY in Jalisco, pork, red onions and LOTS of sauce--YUMMY!!!  We also LOVED the fried quesadilla of rose petals and cheese.  The whole tour was simply amazing.  Amaya is both personable and knowledgable.  I TOTALLY recommend this tour!!!

239111722.name: A wonderful way to tour Tlaquepaque.
239111722.author: a TripAdvisor user
239111722.reviewBody: We spent 3 nights in Tlaquepaque with our friends from Mexico City and Amaya from Mexican Food Tours spent about 4 hours with us on this fantastic walking tour of Tlaquepaque.  We visited the market, tasted many new delicious foods, amazing drinks, saw art galleries, learnt about the history and much, much more.  By the end of the tour we had eaten so much we didn\'t need to eat again for many hours.  This was a great way to see Tlaquepaque on our first day and we congratulate Mexican Food Tours for a wonderful tour with the delightful Amaya.

204980854.name: Great experience
204980854.author: a TripAdvisor user
204980854.reviewBody:
This was a perfect introduction to different aspects of Mexican food as well a nice tour of beautiful Tlaquepaque. 

It turned out to be a private tour for the three of us as there were no other bookings that day (Easter Sunday) and it also turned out that our guide had spent a year as an exchange student in Germany not far from where we live so we could make her practice her German again.
Very well done, Thank you

204613859.name: Delightful and delicious!
204613859.author: a TripAdvisor user
204613859.reviewBody: We were a group of ten Canadians, spending time in Guadalajara before a wedding. The food tour in Tlaquepaque was the perfect outing for us. Amaya was our guide and she was knowledgeable and very pleasant. The area of Tlaquepaque was historical, quaint and great for shopping. Our food samples were ample and delicious. We were all impressed with the tour and had an awesome experience. Thank you Amaya!

184973809.name: Excelent!
184973809.author: a TripAdvisor user
184973809.reviewBody: Amazing experience, you get to know Tlaquepaque, and you get to know all the delicious Mexican dishes.\n\n10/10!!

164353432.name: Delicious way to discover Mexico
164353432.author: a TripAdvisor user
164353432.reviewBody: We have been in several food tours, and it was great to realize there was one in Tlaquepaque, nearby Guadalajara. We were three, our guide was very nice and answered all our inquires. It was a very easy way to discover the town, and try its delicious food. I highly recommend it

162588469.name: WOW \u00a1\u00a1
162588469.author: a TripAdvisor user
162588469.reviewBody:
My wife and I visited Tlaquepaque and we decided to take this tour today... it was a great experience¡  I have to say that I own and operate a Mexican Cooking Workshop for tourists. 
And all I can say for Mexican Food Tours in Tlaquepaque is CONGRATULATIONS 
The selection of the eateries and typical dishes was carefully done.
Amaya is an extrordinary hostess, very knowledgeable and extremely kind, I will  recommend this activity to everyone who visit Tlaquepaque.
Muchas gracias.

160577801.name: Mexican Food Tours (Tlaquepaque)
160577801.author: a TripAdvisor user
160577801.reviewBody:
The tour was fantastic for a person wanting to learn about the Mexician culture  and traditional food. I learned about the local history, how to eat some of the common foods and learned about the location enough to return on my own to explore. The guide was very knowledgeable and spoke both Spanish and English very well.

We ate at 8 different locations, small portions, and everything was well prepared. The fee to joint the tour included all the food.

I would strongly recommend this to anyone who is interested in culture and wishing to explore.

149297556.name: A great experience
149297556.author: a TripAdvisor user
149297556.reviewBody: I took this tour and it was really worth it.  A very interesting and enjoyable walking and food tasting tour.  The town is beautiful and the hostess very charming.  After the tour you can stay and go back to the places you liked, browse the stores, listen to mariachi music over a drink or two and make it a very satisfying full day trip.

669724422.name: Spend a half day
669724422.author: a TripAdvisor user
669724422.reviewBody: Wander up and down this attractive, pedestrian friendly street and admire the multiple shops, art galleries, and restaurants.  Very attractive, and fabulous shopping.

669222523.name: Plenty of art and history on this walk!
669222523.author: a TripAdvisor user
669222523.reviewBody: This area was our favorite part of the greater Guadalajara area that we got the opportunity to see. The buildings are very colorful and covered in all sorts of interesting sculptures and art. Cars are not allowed to drive on this street. There are tons of art studios and galleries as well as stores selling crafts.

666022314.name: Walking History
666022314.author: a TripAdvisor user
