666022314.reviewBody: Talquepaque was once the refuge for the colonial rich of Guadalajara, today many compare this broad pedestrian to Rodeo Drive . . . although do not mistake this for high end shopping. Instead these several blocks of great shops and restaurants cater to ordinary tourists seeking to see historic and elegant homes that have been turned into shops, art galleries and good restaurants and coffee shops. Sergio Bustamonte is an absolute must as it is an artistic gallery featuring the artists original works set in fantasy gardens, gallery setting and of course everything is for sale . . . beautiful and original silver jewlery that is priced well. Almost every shop has something to appeal to every menber of the family, children, men (there are lovely shirts, shoes, leather goods and tequila), women of there are clothing stores, jewelry and home decorating items that are unique to Mexico. I love to go on Sunday afternoon or early evening. Everyday at three PM the famous womens Mariachi band seranades clientele at EL Patio Restaurant (reservations are not required, but help) Come and see things unique to Talquepaque

663886580.name: Quaint, traditional, friendly.
663886580.author: a TripAdvisor user
663886580.reviewBody: Quaint, traditional town square and great shops that are browser friendly. The people are lovely and the weather was great. Loads of places to eat - and tons of variety. Love it!

660652248.name: Wonderful stroll!
660652248.author: a TripAdvisor user
660652248.reviewBody: Lined with shops and dining options this is a wonderful way to spend a day...or more. Coffee or breakfast at Chai great! Dinner favorite on Independencia is Casa Fuerte. Many spots to stop for drinks and snacks. Shopping runs from tourist trinkets to fine art, furniture, clothing and jewelry. A bit crowded on weekends but not terrible. Interesting and fun. Go!

659144790.name: Incredible artistry to see and buy
659144790.author: a TripAdvisor user
659144790.reviewBody: This street has everything from coconut water vendors and necklace beaders to the finest paintings, tapestries, sculptures. It\'s alive with the arts and happy people.

651782037.name: Beautiful, quaint and artistic...easy to navigate.
651782037.author: a TripAdvisor user
651782037.reviewBody: Juarez St and Independencia were such charming and active streets...lots of food, drink, art, shopping and music!

649044991.name: Knick Knack Stores and Restaurant Row
649044991.author: a TripAdvisor user
649044991.reviewBody: This street is car free and full of life. Lots of stores and restaurants. During the day street vendors selling their wares from stands. Cheap to more expensive souvenirs.

647431143.name: Shopping and Restaurants
647431143.author: a TripAdvisor user
647431143.reviewBody: Many traffic-free blocks of fantastic shops and galleries. Be sure to spend some time in Del Corazon de la Tierra. Many salas filled with beautiful artisan work.

647194624.name: Huge merchandising store
647194624.author: a TripAdvisor user
647194624.reviewBody: Tlaquepaque is worth a visit and I am happy I went. Nice city with a village-feeling and very easy to reach within Guadalajara. But I didn\'t know what to do more than for half a day, and that included coffee and lunch. It is full of shops, especially art and antiques, which is never easy to transport, and most shops are also not photo friendly, many have signs that say there are not Museums etc. Unless you go for shopping, don\'t plan more than a few hours.

632658680.name: Fun walk and shopping
632658680.author: a TripAdvisor user
632658680.reviewBody: Went on a Friday night. The place was very lively. It was fun checking out different stores along the Ave. got very crowded by 7:30-8:30pm. Tried to get a table at Casa Luna, but ended up leaving. Three hostesses and they couldn\u2019t tell us how long a table would take. When we asked they just stared at us like we were inconveniencing them and said just a few minutes. So we left and went to El Patio. Food was good, kid play structure was a plus. Slow service. \nLots of families and kids playing on the plaza. Lots of snack stalls around the plaza. Got some souvenirs from both stores and little stalls. Prices were not bad. Most stores closed by 9pm. Easy to get Uber and taxi.

631699387.name: A little bit of everything!
631699387.author: a TripAdvisor user
631699387.reviewBody: This is a great place to shop, eat or just people watch.  We visited this street multiple times over our stay and thoroughly enjoyed the sights. They had several great galleries/shops with amazing finds. We were there during the Dia de Los Muertos festivities so it was beyond crowded but we also had a chance to look around a few days before it got too crazy.

626266627.name: Amazing place to shop and stroll
626266627.author: a TripAdvisor user
626266627.reviewBody: This place is the best- one of my favorite moments from our trip to Jalisco. This little shopping district is the best place to buy beautiful local ceramics, textiles, jewelry, art, books- you name it! There are plenty of great restaurant and bar options, mariachis and street performers, and vendors everywhere. I love it- anyone in the Guadalajara area should go!

620533219.name: Great shopping
620533219.author: a TripAdvisor user
620533219.reviewBody: Wonderful place to stroll and find all the things you didn\u2019t know you couldn\u2019t live without. Easy to get to, stores all helpful, plenty of places to eat, have coffee or ice cream.

595972008.name: Lovely stroll through town center
595972008.author: a TripAdvisor user
595972008.reviewBody: Tlaquepaque isn\'t as busy as other towns we visited in the area, but it has a really nice string of shops, restaurants, and stands for you to enjoy. Lots of little souvenirs and trinkets to purchase. There\'s also a really cool designer store that had the best catrinas (the hand-painted skeleton dolls) we saw on all of our trip. It\'s a lovely place to spend a chill afternoon and maybe take some things home.

591497477.name: Mexican typical
591497477.author: a TripAdvisor user
591497477.reviewBody: This is a very crowded place but this is a very typical pf any mexican down town. You can find hand crafted things and they will be cheaper than the airport stuff. They accept Visa and MasterCard on the indoor stores and only cash on the outside smaller stores (karts). If you are near by Guadalajar you can get ther in Uber for arround 5 usd. It is 30 minutes away. Great place!

590763028.name: A must do when in the area!
590763028.author: a TripAdvisor user
590763028.reviewBody: My wife and I had a few hours to kill while on a layover at GDL. We decided to take advantage of this time and visit Tlaqupaque.  We had a great time eating, drinking, and shopping. Independencia Avenue was a little crowded, but very fun. There are lots of bars, restaurants, and shops along the street.  The street was also lined with colorful banners. We had a great time experiencing what the area had to offer. We will most definitely be back there in the future to explore more of Tlaquepaque.

589606113.name: Take a stroll through the marketplace
589606113.author: a TripAdvisor user
589606113.reviewBody:
Independencia is the central avenue of an open marketplace with a wide variety of shops, restaurants, and street vendors. It's well worth the effort to visit. You'll find upscale jewelers and trendy home goods as well as larger than life religious statuary. High quality leather, crafts, glassware, and metalworking shops abound. We found shopkeepers to be friendly, helpful, and willing to go the extra mile to accommodate packaging for travelers on delicate items. We saw a pharmacy and urgent clinic. Most of our group was English speaking but had only minimal language issues. Cash currency is pesos denomination with ample credit card acceptance. There is a bank in the district but I didn't research whether they exchanged US dollars. We exchanged at the airport.
    It's part of a district that includes museums, historic cathedrals and government agencies. Charming boutique hotels and B&Bs are within easy walking distance. There's something for everyone. 
    My group of 5 spent 2 days in the district with family and friends while we previewed the area to plan a destination wedding for 75-100 guests. We sampled several restaurants with consistent high quality. Italian food and pizza were available along with sandwiches andok traditional Mexican options.
      There were some individual street performers and we saw flaminco dancers with live mariachi band at a venue at scheduled times.
      Our wedding guests will have a couple of hours free on each of two days to tourist and explore. We found a Starbuck's, a sports pub, microbrewery, ice cream shop easily. Our guests will have no problem finding interesting ways to fill time that's outside our function schedule.
       It was my first visit to Guadalajara. This district is clean and well populated without being crowded. I had no concerns for personal safety in our small group and feel comfortable that our guests will have a similar experience. We saw police patrols both walking and driving, but it was not any more than I'd encounter in my home community. We did see officers with semi automatic wespons and saw one K-9 patrol. Members of our group have lived in the area for many years so we're confident that this is the norm here. 
        Once you venture off Independencia, the streets in the district have narrow sidewalks with telephone poles in the middle. This prohibits wheelchair access. The side streets are narrow cobblestone paved one way streets for traffic. There is frequently one lane of parked vehicles and one lane moving. The drivers are in a rush to get through. You're not taking your life in your hands, but caution is needed. 
        I won't spoil the surprise, but you'll find a Guinness Book of World Records location during your visit to this district.

586749421.name: Festive street market
586749421.author: a TripAdvisor user
586749421.reviewBody: We loved going to the little shops and the small vendors.  This was our go to place for supper at the different restaurants.  Lots of activity the whole week we were there.

586413931.name: Great shops, Public art and sculpture and Terrific people-watching
586413931.author: a TripAdvisor user
586413931.reviewBody:
We strolled around Independencia Avenue and had a blast.  We people watched, Enjoyed the public art and had a passable dinner of ceviche and guacamole.  I'm sure we could have found an excellent restaurant but we really didn't try. 

We sat in the church square during a service and enjoyed seeing the families attending together.  

The shops range from chic furniture and accessories to laid back souvenir shops so everybody will see something that intrigues them.  A Must if you are in Tlaquepaque.  

Stay at the Quinto Don Jose Boutique Hotel--in one of the Villas across the street--especially if you're traveling with doggies as we were.

585635715.name: Highly Recommend, shopping, strolling.  Very quaint.
585635715.author: a TripAdvisor user
585635715.reviewBody: Great area for walking, shopping and eating.  Wonderful selection of shops, from tourist trinkets to high end art and sculpture.  If you are tired of shopping, many, many bars, cafes and restaurants to choose from.  We spend the better part of a day here and enjoyed every minute.

584929264.name: Fun and charming
584929264.author: a TripAdvisor user
584929264.reviewBody: Lovely area for walking and shopping. Be sure to have pesos if you want to pick up some souvenirs.\nWe easily spent over three hours here.

582245661.name: so fun and vivid
582245661.author: a TripAdvisor user
582245661.reviewBody: I was able to introduce my partner to this lovely quaint pedestrian walkway on a historical street. The architecture is a must see for it\'s age. A little too busy and crowded, but it was Mother\'s Day. The shops were nice. In the evening most shops close and there are many cafes, restaurants and bars to dine in. A ton of street vendors showed up which sell the most amazing food! There are lots of deals to be found, (However the tiangis in Tonala is a better price if you can handle the crowds). I loved being in my own culture, surrounded by art and history and able to speak in my native language. So Fun!

579920220.name: Picturesque
579920220.author: a TripAdvisor user
579920220.reviewBody: Lovely for walking and shopping. Beautiful shops. Eventhough you\'re not shopping, you can stop in a caf\u00e9 for a coffee or a beer, or even wander around \nand don\'t spend a penny.

570254874.name: The Soho, Yorkville, upscale market of Guad.
570254874.author: a TripAdvisor user
570254874.reviewBody: Stores and restaurants displaying the endless charm and inventiveness of the Mexican people.  Ever seen or dreamt of anything you want in the material world?  From Barogue Altars for your family church to a hot leather jacket or table from 4 foot diameter natural mesquite, they can make it for you. All without breaking the bank.

570011441.name: So Pretty!
570011441.author: a TripAdvisor user
570011441.reviewBody: Not only is papel picado adorning the avenue but there are many, many umbrellas also hanging above.  What a pretty place to visit!  So many shops, restaurants...

567573098.name: Mexico Imagined
567573098.author: a TripAdvisor user
567573098.reviewBody: If only it were really like this.  The big factor is the lack of traffic which provides unusual serenity.  Just miles away from the chaotic bustle of the modern city, this makes a nice refuge whether you are sitting in the plaza, strolling, taking in the wonderful colonial architecture or just noshing.  Easy place to while away the day.

566332144.name: A sunny day for a stroll and a quick look into numerous small stores is the essence of Independencia Avenue.
566332144.author: a TripAdvisor user
566332144.reviewBody: We spent two days wondering up and down this lively piece of Tlaquepaque and enjoyed every second. First of all there are all the little stores with a variety of items from junk to museum pieces. Secondly are all the restaurants that have anything you may desire. Finally there are the variety of people you can sit and watch as you sit and enjoy your beer or cafe!

564277265.name: Girls shopping trip
564277265.author: a TripAdvisor user
564277265.reviewBody: This street is, of course, a must for any trip to Tlaquepaque! The stores are beautiful and the buildings so wonderful. \nThe last few times it\u2019s been very busy ( especially on a Friday evening and the weekend). For a more relaxing time, maybe try to see it midweek.

562371493.name: Lively, fun place to shop
562371493.author: a TripAdvisor user
562371493.reviewBody: I love walking Independencia Avenida in Tlaquepaque.  There are so many great shops, galleries, restaurants, furniture stores and museums in just a few blocks distance.\nVery fun to dine at one of the restaurant\u2019s outdoor tables and watch the foot traffic.

561487364.name: Wonderful Day
561487364.author: a TripAdvisor user
561487364.reviewBody: Had a very nice day wondering the different stores in the area. Pleasant shops and vendors. Quite touristed. Good for a few hours of roaming.

557989022.name: Beautiful Experience
557989022.author: a TripAdvisor user
557989022.reviewBody: Walk along this lovely Street and enjoy the beautiful artwork on display.  Visit with the merchants selling their wares along the street and explore the shops that sell not only souvenirs but leather goods, purses, shoes, jewelry and children\'s toys.  Be sure to take in one of the wonderful restaurants along the way.  Once you get to the square, be sure to peak into the cathedral.

556212492.name: Entertaining stroll
556212492.author: a TripAdvisor user
556212492.reviewBody: Evening and daytime entertainment. Each time of day is different. Tourist stores, lighting stores, art stores, restaurantes and cafes. A few street entertainers. Good people watching.

554690080.name: This is my favorite street in Tlaquepaque
554690080.author: a TripAdvisor user
554690080.reviewBody: There are many beautiful shops here.   Sergio Bustamente Gallery is always our favorite.  He is such a wonderfully talented artist!  What an imagination this man has!  Don\'t miss this.  Also has a very lovely selection of interesting jewelry.  I received an early birthday present today, which I love.

554503934.name: Take it all in!
554503934.author: a TripAdvisor user
554503934.reviewBody: We spent three nights at a B&B in Tlaquepaque and had three meals on Independence Avenue, which were all great, true Mexican cuisine.  We also walked into nearly all the shops on the Avenue and found many that were interesting and informative.  We also made some purchases from the clothing shops as there was plenty to choose from.  We like the Avenue as no vehicles are permitted.  Great Avenue to explore at a slow pace!

552607917.name: Beautiful Town
552607917.author: a TripAdvisor user
552607917.reviewBody: I had the best time strolling on the street and doing some shopping from local artisans and browsing through the art galleries.

548852407.name: Great people watching!
548852407.author: a TripAdvisor user
548852407.reviewBody: This pedestrian only street is the main promenade for Mexican families.  We wandered around looking at the fine art, silver, pottery, antiques, but mainly the people in the street.  We love the Mexican people!

547421673.name: Nice shopping area
547421673.author: a TripAdvisor user
547421673.reviewBody: We took the Tapatio Bus which drops you off at Plaza de las Artesanias, one block from Independencia. It was a nice strolling street with a variety of shops both touristy, gallery and home decor. There were several nice looking restaurants with outdoor seating but we only spent 2 hours in Tlaquepaque so didn\u2019t eat.

544708066.name: Shop til you drop!!
544708066.author: a TripAdvisor user
544708066.reviewBody: We went to Independencia Avenue many times during our stay in Tlaquepaque.  It is a street, without cars, with many restaurants and a variety of shops.  I found wonderful clothing, many pieces of art, and gifts for the family.  The prices in the stores were very reasonable.  We loved it!!

541574975.name: Great place for a stroll and souvenir shopping
541574975.author: a TripAdvisor user
541574975.reviewBody: Spent a few hours exploring all the shops in this street and let me tell you... there are plenty of them!. While not having mercado prices, they are still decently priced and have trinkets from all over Mexico not only Jalisco. There are a few higher end stores that you should avoid, but those are easy to identify. There are plenty of bars and restaurants to pick (we recommend Casa Luna) to have a few drinks or a full meal.

537233376.name: High priced tourist shops
537233376.author: a TripAdvisor user
537233376.reviewBody: Cleaner than Guadalajara, but what isn\'t, this artisan village caters to tourists. Beautiful items with sky high prices; lovely garden but filthy, scary public restrooms. We would not visit Tlaquepaque again.

536498859.name: Do visit. It is beautiful
536498859.author: a TripAdvisor user
536498859.reviewBody: We walked around the independence avenue after eating at the casa Luna (you must try that as well). It is a pedestrian only  street with local shops and wonderful restaurants. It is a great way to spend an evening with your family or loved one. There is also lots of live music so just follow the sounds.

534960789.name: Ya Gotta
534960789.author: a TripAdvisor user
534960789.reviewBody: A fun area to wander around and pop into all of the artisan shops.  Such great energy in the main plaza....if you want to experience REAL Mexico come here.  You won\'t be disappointed.

533184032.name: Lots to see
533184032.author: a TripAdvisor user
533184032.reviewBody: This is the main shopping area for Tlaquepaque. This is the street you want to be within walking distance from your hotel. There are many nice shops and restaurants and markets to check out.

529981487.name: Must go
529981487.author: a TripAdvisor user
529981487.reviewBody: Went to Tlaquepaque on a Sunday early afternoon.  Can see lots of people having buffet lunch in the restaurants along the avenue.  But of course people come here for Mexican arts and souvenirs.  From home deco, arts to jewelry.  Even we did not get anything there, it was still a very enjoyable for window shopping.

528866605.name: A must stop if going to Guadalajara
528866605.author: a TripAdvisor user
528866605.reviewBody: We were told to visit tlaquepeque on the outskirts of Guadalajara. This place was so amazing. If you like furniture and home decor, this place with not disappoint. The art is also beautiful. The town is very clean and has a charming atmosphere. The streets were just beautiful to walk.

526527651.name: Fun
526527651.author: a TripAdvisor user
526527651.reviewBody: Beautiful street with great restaurants and shops. The plaza is very nice. A definite must do when in Guadalajara.

522673953.name: Gorgeous artisan streets and shopping
522673953.author: a TripAdvisor user
522673953.reviewBody: This is gorgeous. Not the cheapest, but very much more artisan and unique shopping experience. So beautiful. I only spent 3 hours, but I could have spent all day.

522583739.name: Vacation in Guadalajara.
522583739.author: a TripAdvisor user
522583739.reviewBody: Beautiful, quaint, historical and fun! We loved it! We spent hours walking around, checking out the stores, listening to a Mariachi band, and eating delicious Mexican food. Just a 30 minute drive from where we were in Guadalajara, can\'t wait to visit again.

521933321.name: Great Artesan-Craft Shops & Restaurants
521933321.author: a TripAdvisor user
521933321.reviewBody: A must see/stop.  On a Sunday afternoon Independencia becomes a strolling promenade with street performers and fun people watching.  Shops have unusual and creative souvenirs and household crafts - it\'s easy to find treasures to take home.  We especially  liked El Dorado Galeria for their unique items.  Restaurant Casa Luna is a must for fun & delicious dining.  Be sure to bring an umbrella during the rainy season - there\'s a rain deluge guaranteed at some time during the day/night here.

518198784.name: Worth an hour or two
518198784.author: a TripAdvisor user
518198784.reviewBody: The Tlaquepaque area has some fun and unique Artisan shops, quaint restaurants, and some historic buildings that are all worth seeing.  I purchased some great crafts/art from some of the Artisan shops for display in my home.  The only arts/crafts I purchased while in Guadalajara I purchased from the Artisan shops in Tlaquepaque.

514896005.name: Walking street!
514896005.author: a TripAdvisor user
514896005.reviewBody: Lively walking street,lots of shops and restaurants,perhaps the heart of Tlaquepaque.\nBeautiful architecture, there are 2 main churches and more..The Rodo Padilla Gallery is probably the best display of art...

514525542.name: Nice walkable promenade
514525542.author: a TripAdvisor user
514525542.reviewBody: Lots of shopping, restaurants and interesting galleries to visit. You get to experience more of the town and its people.

508764566.name: Independencia
508764566.author: a TripAdvisor user
508764566.reviewBody: Great shopping and restaurants.  Would take the dogs for a walk in the morning and it was quiet and serene.  The afternoon started to wake up with shoppers and visitors in a great shopping Mecca.  Then at night magical.

507939738.name: Go on a Sunday for the real experience, TIP for Shopping, go on a weekday!
507939738.author: a TripAdvisor user
507939738.reviewBody: You walk through a pedestrian street flanked by beautiful old houses, a museum and many art galleries. You will find traditional art, as well as more modern art, such as the Sergio Bustamante Gallery (Go inside, it is great). I recommend you visit on a sunday because that is when the people who live there go for a walk and spend the day there. Walk until you reach the Hidalgo Garden and grab a flavorful Garrafa Ice Cream or Coffee and enjoy the sight of a typical mexican family gathering. REMEMBER, there are a lot of art galleries, but they are expensive! There are NO PUBLIC BATHROOMS

505961164.name: Discover the Artists of Tlaquepaque
505961164.author: a TripAdvisor user
505961164.reviewBody:
Independencia Avenue in Tlaquepaque is the best of the best in the whole 
Guadalajara area.  Every art you can think of is represented here.  Painting, pottery, metal work, jewelry, clothing, leather work, sculpture, stained glass, works in copper,
accessories, food and drink are clustered here in an easily navigated street of dreams.

The most astounding gallery of sculpture, paintings and jewelry by Sergio Bustamante is worth an hour of your time. This beautiful gallery is an indoor and outdoor architectural gem  accentuated by  a large collection of works by the artist.

The beautiful jewelry seemed very affordable and consisted of bracelets, cuffs, necklaces, and rings. My favorite pieces of jewelry was two toned in silver and gold.

For the sculpture buffs, most pieces were in range for the more extravagant of collectors. Some pieces could be easily affordable for some of us. For those who need to enjoy art at its most creative and leave it for collectors, this space is a not-to-be-missed delight.

Painter and art genius Claudio Ha has several paintings complete with electrical wiring for your perusal. I kept his phone number for a future purchase. Wow, what a young talent!! Pure genius. I felt like I was in the presence of an Andy Warhol level of pure magic.

Lighting at Preciado Illumination was a use of blown glass and metal. Beautiful colors.
Pottery works of art at Obras de Arte Indigenous touched my soul. I bought unusual jewelry at Yoya; #248. Inside the leaf-like beads are bougainvillea bits of pink.  The "leaves" are attached beautifully to a long black rope which will encircle the neck.

Don't miss this!

504048554.name: Art and food
504048554.author: a TripAdvisor user
504048554.reviewBody: We stayed one night in Guadalajara after flying in to the airport. Calle Independencia is not too far from the airport, about 20-30 minutes in traffic. We found parking close to the town center and paid a guy $2 American dollars to watch the car. The street is colorful and blocked off to car traffic. We enjoyed going int the different shops to see the hand made souvenirs and art. We happened to visit as there was a festival going on. Lots of street vendors and a live band in the town center. I would defiantly recommend a stop here if you have even just a few hours in Guadalajara. I would think you would need 2-3 hours to enjoy this area but it certainly has more to offer if you want to spend half a day here. My 7 year old thoroughly enjoyed the street art and the food!

496999967.name: Great place to walk
496999967.author: a TripAdvisor user
496999967.reviewBody: Independencia is closed to auto traffic so is an excellent place for leisurely walk.  Beautiful old haciendas dating back to late 1700\'s.  Some converted to museums, restaurants & galleries.  Amazing how large they are. You can almost imagine life in those times.  Lots of other stores to visit as well

496381265.name: Getting here to Tlaquepaque was a chore in itself
496381265.author: a TripAdvisor user
496381265.reviewBody:
The place where Lonely Planet said to take the bus was NOT the right place and the old place, by the Cathedral is closed because the city is constructing a new line for the light rail. I had to ask about 6 people how to get here. No one seemed to know the correct bus number or location. I finally asked a lady who said she lived by here, and told me that she would wait for the bus with me. I was so grateful for that. The locals asked me, What part of Tlaquepaque do you want to go to? I replied that I do not know since I am a visitor from Cd. Juarez. Once on the bus which only cost 7 pesos, I was on my way here. Another lady who was sitting down told me which corner to get out. There are nice people out there and thank God, I learned how to speak Spanish before English

Once I got off the bus, I looked for the tourist kiosk. They gladly gave me a map and told me to go down Independence Avenue. It is a sidewalk, no traffic is allowed here. There seemed to be some museums here, but since it was Monday most were closed. Also a lot of shops too. But my luggage is about to burst from all the stuff I have bought on this little trip, so I really did not stop in many shops. Plus most of this stuff is lower priced in my hometown of Cd. Juarez, Chihuahua. However, I stopped at a shop that sold ceramic stuff..It was so cute. The lady told me that the merchandise was made by the artesans here in Tlaquepaque. I could not resist the small cactus and locket I bought. She took a long time to wrap it, but that is ok. It is going to be transported back to Cd. Juarez on a plane. I noticed no 2 items were alike.

I also visited a couple of churches, but not any restaurants cuz I was full from eating at the Mercado. I did get a cup of coffee at the OK coffee shop. It is worth a visit because this little suburb of Guadajara is like a little laid back town. Just be careful how to get here

496355059.name: Fun shopping
496355059.author: a TripAdvisor user
496355059.reviewBody: Lots of interesting shops and restaurants here.  You will find street performers and a few beggars, but nothing jarring.  Great arts and crafts, but the prices are a little high.  You can get better deals in Tonala or Guadalajara, but the atmosphere is nice in Tlaquepaque.

495481429.name: Fun walk filled with colors
495481429.author: a TripAdvisor user
495481429.reviewBody: A great place to walk and people watch, shop and eat .  This is a pedestrian road filled with shops and restaurants . A must see in Tlaquepaque.

494565466.name: Expected More
494565466.author: a TripAdvisor user
494565466.reviewBody:
Everyone talks about Tlaquepaque so I was expecting more.

It is OK but nothing in the incredible side.

The stores are good with a variety of things to buy but a little expensive.

The restaurants are really good and it deserves a visit for a couple hours.

490975942.name: Great Walking Avenue
490975942.author: a TripAdvisor user
490975942.reviewBody: This is a great place to spend a few hours.  Arts and crafts, galleries, restaurants and street sculptures galore. No cars, but lots of friendly folks with families.  Mostly local people from Guadalajara that come on the weekends.  Good food to be eaten and great tequila. Enjoy!

489663800.name: Love it
489663800.author: a TripAdvisor user
489663800.reviewBody: There is always something exciting to see, eat, do while walking through this street. Make sure you stop by and get some nieve de garaffa.

489513730.name: So many incredible shops and restaurants!
489513730.author: a TripAdvisor user
489513730.reviewBody: This is a fabulous street to stroll along - a mixture of restaurants, art galleries, and specialty shops not to be missed! Closed to all traffic, it is enjoyable to just sit and people watch along the avenue.

489505462.name: A must see while in Guadalajara
489505462.author: a TripAdvisor user
489505462.reviewBody: This place was such a pleasant surprise. The perfect mix of art galleries, crafts, caffees and excelent authentic mexican restaurants. You can easily spend half a day here.

488551552.name: Didn\'t know what to expect
488551552.author: a TripAdvisor user
488551552.reviewBody: Pleasantly surprised by this shopping/Artisan area. Clean and friendly with street kiosks and a lot of neat Stores to poke around in. We spent a couple hours each day putzing through. Good times

488479233.name: Walk, shop, & eat
488479233.author: a TripAdvisor user
488479233.reviewBody: If the weather is good this is a great place to walk and see the sights. There are many nice restaurants on this street. You can have a quick bite to eat or a gourmet meal here. Plan on at least a couple hours to stroll down this street, more if you stop to eat.

487753358.name: Wonderful Place the stores are like a museums
487753358.author: a TripAdvisor user
487753358.reviewBody: Amazing experience highly recommended a lot of art shops and Bar-restaurants  inside a beautiful old houses Mexican hand crafters with an international reputation show his nice art pieces you can find silver gold leather pottery ceramic along this historical avenue and of course some restaurants with delicious cuisine and drinks with mariachi in the Parian or other restaurant with finest cuisine

485858148.name: Worth the trip
485858148.author: a TripAdvisor user
485858148.reviewBody: It was very easy and inexpensive to take an Uber from downtown Guadalajara to Tlaquepaque and I\'m so glad I did.  There are lots of great shops with Mexican art and crafts.  I enjoyed having a beer and listening to a mariachi band.  There are great stores selling tequila and local products where I bought all my gifts to take home.  This is a really good place to spend a late afternoon/early evening since most shops seem to stay open until 7pm.

484259297.name: Strongly recommended if you plan to visit Guadalajara
484259297.author: a TripAdvisor user
484259297.reviewBody:
It just took less than one hour by car from Guadalajara.
After you spend some days in Guadalajara , if you are looking for a place with different concept from metropolis or a place to buy souvenirs. This would be the best option.
This street is very beautiful and artistic and there are many unique or fancy restaurants and souvenir shops with various kinds of products with good quality.
Even though I couldn't visit any, I heard Tlaquepaque is also well known for many good pottery galleries.
For reference, there are parking lots here and there with reasonable price. So, you can take a car.

483949370.name: A walk into a different view of life
483949370.author: a TripAdvisor user
483949370.reviewBody: I walked through this area and was amazed at all the artisans and their crafts that were displayed you name it, if you need something you can find it here.

481318975.name: Very very nice.
481318975.author: a TripAdvisor user
481318975.reviewBody: Independencia Avenue was one of my favorites.  Great all around soo much to see.  Great place to spend the day.

479608900.name: A nice place for high end shopping
479608900.author: a TripAdvisor user
479608900.reviewBody: I love pedestrian only areas and this one is great. I prefer bargains but loved looking at the shops. There was some sort of outdoor dance just finishing when we got there. Nice places to sit and a lot to look at.

478195442.name: Well preserved and dynamic
478195442.author: a TripAdvisor user
478195442.reviewBody: We got in Tlaquepaque as a stop on our way back from Barra to San Luis Potosi. We were really positively surprised to find this well maintained little town, very dynamic with a lot to see (and shop if that\'s your thing). Several blocks around the main plaza offer a nice morning stroll with colored houses and small artisan shops. I would definitely recommend a stop there.

474675690.name: Lot of things to see, recommended
474675690.author: a TripAdvisor user
474675690.reviewBody: Nice place to walk around during the day or afternoon.  There is lots of different things, from bars and restaurants, to arts and crafts.  You will definitely not be bored here.  I recommend you take an Uber to get here as parking seems limited and traffic is heavy.

467137607.name: Exelent
467137607.author: a TripAdvisor user
467137607.reviewBody: One of The most amazing time I had there cuz the people the it\'s so nice and kind very pretty very different staff for see

465618463.name: Very Interesting but closed too early!
465618463.author: a TripAdvisor user
465618463.reviewBody: We got there about 6pm and all the shops were closed or were closing!  Tons of restaurants still open and just walking around was pretty cool!

465451567.name: Good restaurants and shopping!
465451567.author: a TripAdvisor user
465451567.reviewBody: My husband and I enjoyed a couple days here.  We had a nice hotel on a side street that allowed us to walk and enjoy this trendy neighbourhood.\nA walk down Independencia Avenue is a must!\nHave fun.

461841803.name: Sunday here is quite busy but fun
461841803.author: a TripAdvisor user
461841803.reviewBody: The shops on the pedestrian street in Tlaquepaque are some of the nicest I have seen in Guadalajara.  We arrived around 11 am and it was getting started with people opening up their shops and street vendors laying out their wares.  The restaurants along the street looked good, too, including Casa Luna where we had lunch.  Lots of jewelry stores, art works, accessories, etc.  Definitely a place to visit.

457328225.name: Pedestrian Paradise
457328225.author: a TripAdvisor user
457328225.reviewBody: Independence avenue is a lovely pedestrian street filled with fun public art, shopping and great restaurants. We purchased many pieces of folk art and beautiful textiles. The street ends with the public market which always has a lot of fun activities. Don\'t miss this fun street

456904663.name: Good on a shopping trip
456904663.author: a TripAdvisor user
456904663.reviewBody: We traveled from Puerto Vallarta on a 2 day shopping trip to Tlaquepaque and Tonala.  We thoroughly enjoyed both areas but would have probably needed another 2 days to truly appreciate all of the sites etc ... Worth the trip for sure!

455620241.name: Wonderful Walking Street
455620241.author: a TripAdvisor user
455620241.reviewBody: Great place to shop for arts and crafts, or just to enjoy the ambiance of a typical higher-end Mexican city suburb. A bit touristy, but loved by locals and foreigners alike.

455000601.name: Beautiful Pedestrian Street
455000601.author: a TripAdvisor user
455000601.reviewBody: I stayed in Tlaquepaque for a week and had a chance to spend a lot of time there. Beautiful galleries, fun shopping, unique artworks, fancy restaurants. Too bad some galleries don\'t let you taking photos but I guess they have a good reason for this. Galleries are open only until 5 or 6pm. And this is the time when street food vendors fill up the plaza and streets around Independencia. The food is great cheap and safe. Must try! A lot of locals speak English, so no worries if your Spanish is close to none. Everyone is very friendly and very helpful. I survived there knowing only few words in Spanish and enjoyed every moment!

454632050.name: Beautiful
454632050.author: a TripAdvisor user
454632050.reviewBody: A short distance from Guadalajara. We spent the afternoon strolling around and enjoying the atmosphere.  Lots of restaurants , one of a kind shops and artesanal ice cream ( nieve de garrafa ). Visit the shop/ house of famous Mexican sculpture Sergio Bustamante, amazing art and Jewelry . I\'m the Maine square you can see the voladores de Papantla perform. \nWe loved our day in Tlaquepaque.  \nEasiest way to get here take Uber , very cheap and convenient.

451478384.name: what a cool area.  the shopping is really something!
451478384.author: a TripAdvisor user
451478384.reviewBody:
came here at the suggestion of the hotel staff at the Hampton Inn.  not, were they ever right!

this street in the evening, is really spectacular!  so cool!

the shops are so great, with so many cool things to see and buy.  loved the El Dorado for home furnishings and decorations.  really cool stuff!

ate at Casa Luna (place with the angel wings in front).  wow!  read my review of this fine, fun restaurant!  really great!

highly recommended!

450294699.name: Wonderful shopping!
450294699.author: a TripAdvisor user
450294699.reviewBody: Many unique shops offering artisanal goods amid small restaurants & eateries.  Stroll down Independencia enjoy a leisurely afternoon in the heart of beautiful Tlaquepaque!

449736598.name: Fascinating shopping avenue
449736598.author: a TripAdvisor user
449736598.reviewBody: Historic Independencia Avenue in Tlaquepaque is very much worth a visit. The old haciendas, converted to shops, are gorgeous and house beautiful artifacts. Street musicians add to the charm. Definitely a must-see.

448064582.name: The heart of Tlaquepaque
448064582.author: a TripAdvisor user
448064582.reviewBody: This is a pedestrian street at the heart of Tlaquepaque, lined with art galleries/stores and restaurants. It was pleasant to walk up and down Independencia day and night and sometimes sit on a bench to watch people go by while eating delicious ice cream or sipping on coffee.

444134641.name: Cool shops and restaurants
444134641.author: a TripAdvisor user
444134641.reviewBody: This is a great, pedestrian friendly street to see a variety of cool shops or to enjoy the grand old buildings and people watch. There are a number of places to grab a snack or have a nice dinner. It\'s well worth checking out if you are visiting the Guadalajara area.

442493116.name: This is the place for beautiful shops
442493116.author: a TripAdvisor user
442493116.reviewBody: This andador (pedestrian only) street is lined with beautiful shops and restaurants.  There is something for everyone.

441162375.name: Lots of shops and restaurants
441162375.author: a TripAdvisor user
441162375.reviewBody: Great place to walk and shop around.  Great stores that offer typical Mexican artifacts and a variety of restaurants to choose from.

437932304.name: Charming Town/Nice place to shop and hang out in
437932304.author: a TripAdvisor user
437932304.reviewBody: We hung out here for the day. We drove in from Guadalajara, it was a 35-40min drive. I liked that it differs from a big city and it has a charming feel to it. Its super touristy and a bit over priced. You are very unlikely to get anything super cheap as you would other places in Mexico. But, its good for the town and I\'m okay with that. Its super clean and the stores are all independently owned. Would love to visit again and spend more time here.

437176282.name: Still Good but Slipping
437176282.author: a TripAdvisor user
437176282.reviewBody: We have been observing the evolution of Independencia Avenue for 16+ years and cannot say that we are personally pleased with the direction it is headed.  The numbers of galleries, nice shops specializing in items of decoration, jewelry stores, clothing shops and crafts stores have been reduced and replaced initially by better restaurants and now by restaurants serving quick food items.\n\nWe weren\'t there on a weekend this trip but I am going to guess the traditional traffic of Mexican families may be dropping on the weekends?  The feel is going away and we are not far from reducing our rating to average.

434807750.name: This is the why you came to Tlaquepaque
434807750.author: a TripAdvisor user
434807750.reviewBody: This area is the primary reason most people come to Tlaquepaque so stroll the streets, take in the sites, check out the Arts and Craft shops and enjoy!  The atmosphere is relaxed and fun the shopkeepers pleasant and helpful and the car free streets make walking all the more enjoyable.

434619534.name: Fascinating pedestrian street
434619534.author: a TripAdvisor user
434619534.reviewBody: There\'s Bustamonte sculptures and fat large painted pigs along the sides; many artisan shops along the way, with outdoor vendors, too.  It was specially decorated in anticipation of Dia de los Muertos.

434346024.name: Safe, fun open market
434346024.author: a TripAdvisor user
434346024.reviewBody: Tlaquepaque is closed to cars. You are free to walk around. Lots of artisanal crafts and great place to buy quality items.

433815996.name: Tourist friendly, artisan shops, historic buildings
433815996.author: a TripAdvisor user
433815996.reviewBody: People that I have brought here love this place. It\'s got something for everyone: historic buildings (many shops are located inside old mansions), artisan shopping (some times they even have festivals where they bring hand-made goods from various parts of Mexico, and it is very tourist friendly here. Accepts credit cards. A lot of mom & pops shops.

430453604.name: Superb Tourist area
430453604.author: a TripAdvisor user
430453604.reviewBody: If you want to buy exquisite furniture, pottery, fabrics, copper kitchen items or just about anything for the house at beyond excellent prices this is the place. Then add to the the beautiful large square with two 17th century churches and tons of history flowing with daily local folks and customs this is it. And then the marvelous huge and I mean huge old hacienda style homes with interior gardens now converted to art galleries etc. Wow. You can spend days here either just admiring or equipping your home.

429674976.name: Great!
429674976.author: a TripAdvisor user
429674976.reviewBody: Such a great way to spend a day!  The kids loved running around getting pics of all the "pigs"!  Loved it!  The galleries were incredible, the art and furniture, amazing!

428479614.name: A must
428479614.author: a TripAdvisor user
428479614.reviewBody: I did not expect too much  as tourist places are mainly just - tourist places. We spend a pleasant afternoon including excellent lunch

420950821.name: Shopping
420950821.author: a TripAdvisor user
420950821.reviewBody: Easy walking for all types of shopping.  Music on the streets, food vendors. Great place to people watch

418621729.name: Best place to hear Mariachis.
418621729.author: a TripAdvisor user
418621729.reviewBody: We stayed during the annual Mariachi festival and heard outstanding bands within two blocks of our hotel.

416239785.name: Don\'t miss it
416239785.author: a TripAdvisor user
416239785.reviewBody: Strolling down Independencia shouldn\'t be missed any time you visit Talaquepaque. Wonderful shops representing the many crafts of the area and restaurants offering some of the best food ever.

412842166.name: Shopping fun!
412842166.author: a TripAdvisor user
412842166.reviewBody: We love the pedestrian streets and the great shops and booths.  There is a wide variety of merchandise and pricing.

405033855.name: Shopping day & a fabulous lunch!
405033855.author: a TripAdvisor user
405033855.reviewBody: We took an Uber to Tlaquepaque from Guadalajara and spent around 4 hours here walking up and down the avenue and eating lunch.  We found a great restaurant (Casa Fuerte) from TA and bought some nice souvenirs here.  They have a lot to choose from, small inexpensive items to larger art and furniture pieces.  I\'m not a big shopper but I enjoyed this day.  You can also include some culture by visiting the church.  There are plenty of restaurants and shops to keep everyone happy I think.

397474299.name: A Walking Delight
397474299.author: a TripAdvisor user
397474299.reviewBody: Independencia Avenue offers many stops along this walking only road.  There are fine restaurants and art galleries along the way.  One of my favorite stop is Sergio Bustamante.  Bustamante\'s work can be observed along the road, as many of his bronze pieces are displayed. \n

397101418.name: A must place to visit...
397101418.author: a TripAdvisor user
397101418.reviewBody:
If you're in Guadalajara, you need to visit Calle independencia in Tlaquepaque, lots of food, stores, candies, snacks, etc...

There is a lot of stores with traditional items from guadalajara and many other town in Mexico, you can spend a whole day in Tlaquepaque and it will not be enough... and just on the next street parallel to Independencia you have many other stores bakeries, traditional  ice cream shops, etc...

Lots of Art, and culture...

388526619.name: Very colonial lots of galleries and lots of food!
388526619.author: a TripAdvisor user
388526619.reviewBody: Second time visiting here, also second time on guadalajara, love to visit the galleries walk on this streets the restaurants are very good!! And food price is not bad at all in the restaurants, galleries are little expense but art is expensive isn\'t?  You can have a great afternoon with the family walking around we love it!

387884816.name: Beutiful
387884816.author: a TripAdvisor user
387884816.reviewBody: Great street to walk and see artisans. Also there are great galleries all over. After you are done with the art maybe eat at one of the restaurants in this street.

387622888.name: Pedestrian walkway with open access to stores
387622888.author: a TripAdvisor user
387622888.reviewBody: There are many shops along the avenue and higher end restaurants.  Try La Luna for great dinner and very interesting interior.  The store "Del Corazon de la Tienda" had unusual clothing and indigenous works of art, mostly in textile venue.  Antigua de Mexico has high end furniture, most which is custom made.  Puerta Bonita had wonderful pottery pieces.  I love this street and it is safe, colorful and filled with people at all hours.

385679074.name: A must
385679074.author: a TripAdvisor user
385679074.reviewBody: Lovely stores but you can definitely get a better deal with the street vendors.  We bought jewelry, a beautiful nativity set and lots of food!

384125103.name: Okay...
384125103.author: a TripAdvisor user
384125103.reviewBody: Too Americanize, expensive! and busy. Many stores to look. Restaurants are pricy. Vendors on street are cheaper then actual stores. \nI have small children, so walking in and out of stores was painful for them, try to go alone. The center of the plaza was very cool, kids played and made a few friends. \nI don\'t recommend the restaurants they are pricy and the Mexican food in Americanize. We did hear Mariachis and trios.

380481018.name: A great pedestrian shopping street
380481018.author: a TripAdvisor user
380481018.reviewBody: Many of the stores are in beautiful old colonial-style houses and are worth exploring for the architecture as well as the shopping.   Shopkeepers have gone to great efforts to have beautifully appointed stores.

374344529.name: Good shopping and good food
374344529.author: a TripAdvisor user
374344529.reviewBody: Enjoyed the collection of stores and restaurants.  A very nice area. Also close to a beautiful church and cultural center.

373413861.name: A great place to visit
373413861.author: a TripAdvisor user
373413861.reviewBody: Starting at the plaza of Tlaquepaque, you can find restaurants, shops and some museums. Nice sculptures, houses and doors to take pictures.

369119697.name: great shopping
369119697.author: a TripAdvisor user
369119697.reviewBody: this cobblestone street is full of old mansions that have been restored to house a wide variety of galleries, shops and restaurants.  there are some high end exquisite items to be found, along with more moderately priced things.

367884695.name: It offers a kind of bohemian style, with  \'ESTUDIANTINA" singers or OPERA players performing on the street.
367884695.author: a TripAdvisor user
367884695.reviewBody: We loved walking in nigh time trough this BEAUTIFUL st. for the people who love the old colonial homes now, Art Centers or fancy Restaurants is a must. You will enjoy this avenue that can lead to a very unique restaurant or a romantic dinner listening to relaxing music while enjoying  a good tequila.

366295347.name: Lovely
366295347.author: a TripAdvisor user
366295347.reviewBody: This was my first city visited in Mexico and that was a proper start! By walking along the pedestrian streets you start loving this country! Authentic shops, corn&chips sellers on the street, colonial architecture, great local restaurants, just amazing! If you are in Guadalajara, you just cannot miss this town!

363403464.name: Beautiful place for a stroll!
363403464.author: a TripAdvisor user
363403464.reviewBody: I decided to visit Tlaquepaque based on the recommendation of my parents, as they had visited Guadalajara previously and I must say I was not disappointed. Avenida Independencia is a beautiful place to stroll during a warm afternoon while exploring its lining restaurants, bars, shops and galleries. The avenue provides visitors with endless photography opportunities and some of the best handicrafts in Guadalajara. Make sure you visit the Rodo Padilla Galery where you will find the most charming clay sculptures.

363325103.name: TlQUEPAQUE SHOPPING
363325103.author: a TripAdvisor user
363325103.reviewBody: The pedestrian walkway along Independencia Ave. has interesting and beautiful shops and restaurants.\n Many are in old mansions and it is very interesting to see how they use these building for today.

360232637.name: Great shopping and eating
360232637.author: a TripAdvisor user
360232637.reviewBody: Although some shops are repetitive, the folks are almost all friendly.  The food quality is great.  Make sure you check out Leo\'s & Son\'s Leather, as well as San Piel.

355154117.name: Visited every day!
355154117.author: a TripAdvisor user
355154117.reviewBody: A wonderful place to stroll and buy and eat.At the end is a large square where the local people meet and have icecream. We sat one evening and people watched it was lovely.

353674724.name: Great Shopping and Architecture
353674724.author: a TripAdvisor user
353674724.reviewBody: Remember to bring your camera - every step is a photo opportunity and the shops are world class. Rivals anyplace else in the area - not to be missed.

352888282.name: A sight to be seen!
352888282.author: a TripAdvisor user
352888282.reviewBody: Tlaquepaque is a beautifully quaint town located a short ride from Guadalajara. We visited based on a recommendation from our hostel and are glad we did. There is a slightly touristy vibe and some of the prices in the shops and restaurants reflect this, however it is definitely worth a visit. Make sure to check out the main square to watch the Danza de Los Voladores!

352506472.name: Beautiful, fun, great photo opportunity!
352506472.author: a TripAdvisor user
352506472.reviewBody: This is my second time visiting in the past month. The shopping and atmosphere is simply wonderful. This time I came with my mother and we haven\'t seen it all. Lots of beautiful galleries and shops with amazing things to buy. Although a bit pricier than Tonala,  Independencia Avenue in Tlaquepaque is a one-street shopping heaven.

348588381.name: Mexico at its best
348588381.author: a TripAdvisor user
348588381.reviewBody: When visiting Guadalajara, Calle Independencia is a sightseeing lover\'s must, it\'s just packed with Mexican folklore and beauty, something to remember with great fondness for a lifetime

348254006.name: shopping!!!
348254006.author: a TripAdvisor user
348254006.reviewBody: great place!!! art galleries, restaurants, Mariachi and lots of shopping for souvenirs!!! loved it!!!!

347664482.name: Shop till you drop
347664482.author: a TripAdvisor user
347664482.reviewBody: some touristy things some marvelous art. Lovely glass pieces and embroidery work. Good benches to rest on or wait while others in your party make purchases.

346023925.name: One of My Favorite Shopping Streets in the World
346023925.author: a TripAdvisor user
346023925.reviewBody: If you\'re short on inspiration you\'re bound to have your creative juices refreshed and reinvigorated here! The showrooms on Independencia offer some of the most inventive, original and unique items for the home and fashionable items to wear, than anywhere else. From outrageous jewelry, textiles, leather goods, and other fashion accessories, to upholstered furniture, chandeliers, glassware, headboards, iron and copper pieces, dining tables, etc....you name it, you\'ll undoubtedly find it displayed somewhere in Tlaquepaque. Independencia is a walking street chock full of characters, both local and tourists. The main plaza is the best for finding a chair at one of the cafes and just sit there people watching. From early mornings to late at night, it\'s always buzzing.  There are also multiple vendors flea market style in and around the plaza to explore, between all the excellent food carts providing grilled corn on the cob or served in a cup with crema and cheese and hot sauce.  There are sausage vendors with long lines waiting to be served.  All sorts of sweets, pastries and candies you may never have ever seen before. Stop to enjoy some coconut milk right from the coconut chopped open right before you, or chew on some sugar cane or drink some cane juice.  It\'s a never ending circus of colors, tastes, and mariachi music thrown in. Go with an open mind because you never know what you\'re going to see or find.  Treasures galore!

339963848.name: Beautiful Stretch of City Street
339963848.author: a TripAdvisor user
339963848.reviewBody: One of the nicest small cities I\'ve ever visited.  Great restaurants, art galleries, and other artistic businesses in historic old mansions along cobblestone streets.

337523945.name: Shop Til You Drop
337523945.author: a TripAdvisor user
337523945.reviewBody: Fabulous shopping along this pedestrian only street. Prices are set for tourists.  However, you won\'t go home empty handed.

336821362.name: Great shopping
336821362.author: a TripAdvisor user
336821362.reviewBody: Indepencia, Juarez great for shopping. Pedestrians only on one of them and they have a great selection of restaurants and shops

336231552.name: Lovely Street Lots Of Shops
336231552.author: a TripAdvisor user
336231552.reviewBody: Stroll through the street and stop at a caf\u00e9 and people watch when you get tried.  Each shop is different and many items to choose from.  A nice experience.

332466458.name: Charming
332466458.author: a TripAdvisor user
332466458.reviewBody: Lots of galleries, shops and eats. Well worth the visit. Strongly suggest a meal at Casa Luna which offers a delightful vibe and great food

331911869.name: If you are in the area it is worth a visit
331911869.author: a TripAdvisor user
331911869.reviewBody: If you are in the Guadalajara area it is worth a visit.  For the most part the restaurants and shops are relatively upscale and expensive.

331217254.name: Nice evening walk
331217254.author: a TripAdvisor user
331217254.reviewBody: This street is the place to be in Tlaquepaque.  Beautiful shops with art and furniture.  It connects with the square by the church.  It\'s a lovely brick street with no cars allowed

330179766.name: Expensive shops, beautiful ware
330179766.author: a TripAdvisor user
330179766.reviewBody: Walking on Independencia Avenue is an enjoyable experience.  It\'s a walking only street, so only pedestrian traffic to worry about, except when crossing intersecting streets.  \n\nThe shops on Independencia Avenue are upscale, for the most part with the run of the mill tourist shops interspersed.  Many of the shops are a rich variety of beautiful home decor, art, jewelry and ceramics.  The prices are also very upscale.

327929520.name: Nice stroll with quality shops
327929520.author: a TripAdvisor user
327929520.reviewBody: Unlike some places that mostly offer souvenirs of poor quality, this area offers quality shopping. It has a great atmosphere with lots of good restaurants and great architecture. You can spend a lot of time walking around here and having a good time. The place has a high-end feeling.

326983162.name: Shop \'Til You Drop, Then Eat
326983162.author: a TripAdvisor user
326983162.reviewBody: Love it! Wide range of shopping & restaurant experiences, plus touristy venues. Check out the two churches in the Jardin Hidalgo.

322796812.name: Lively on a Sunday!
322796812.author: a TripAdvisor user
322796812.reviewBody: We didn\'t know what to expect, only that this was a touristy place to visit and shop.  I don\'t know if we arrivwd o a special day, but it was FULL of dance groups doing traditional native dances, drummers, music, and tons of vendors.  You want cheap souvenirs?? This is your place!!  Lots of high-end and more boutique shops as well.  Very eclectic and a fun ambience.  You could spend hours just wandering the side streets and shopping. Plenty of restaurants, but not very many (obvious or readily available) restrooms.

322050068.name: culturally stimulating
322050068.author: a TripAdvisor user
322050068.reviewBody: Many interesting things to see and do all while enjoying the inspirations of old Mexico. Galleries of unique and important Mexican artists, celebrations of music and food in El Parien and, most of all, the gracious and friendly people!

320207149.name: HAPPY FEET
320207149.author: a TripAdvisor user
320207149.reviewBody: This street is closed to autos and makes it easy to stop and look, shop  or just sit and enjoy the beautiful buildings and all the art work along the avenue.  Many wonderful restaurants, one better than the last.  If you are interested in the arts and culture of Mexico, do not miss this street!

320158185.name: Great SHopping
320158185.author: a TripAdvisor user
320158185.reviewBody: Clean streets, decorated windows, elegant shoppers delight. Home goods, art, clothing, all very unique.

316339716.name: Independencia Makes Tllaquepaque
316339716.author: a TripAdvisor user
316339716.reviewBody: While it has changed a great deal in the 15+ years we have been visiting, it is still an enjoyable experience!  Shops, galleries and restaurants are a constantly changing scene.

313824311.name: A Visual Fest!
313824311.author: a TripAdvisor user
313824311.reviewBody: Great Shopping! Quality, rather high end merchandise. Leather, jewelry, glass wear, fine Artwork, house accessories, light fixtures,\nFurniture, clothes,great Restaurants. Fun pedestrian Zone, classic Mexican Plaza.

311654749.name: Come to Tlaquepaque
311654749.author: a TripAdvisor user
311654749.reviewBody: This is a wonderful pedestrian walkway with galleries, restaurants, and handicraft shops galore. Even with Mexican Independence day, it was not overrun and their were only a few gringos (like us) For shopping it is the best place I have been in Mexico with a huge variety of goods - silver jewellery, metal work, leather, wood of all descriptions and weavings. There are great coffee shops and bars.  If you are in Guadalajara, it is a must.\n

303868019.name: wonderful to stroll
303868019.author: a TripAdvisor user
303868019.reviewBody: Great street to walk and visit all the beautiful stores and restaurants.  More cities should have walking streets with no cars.

303784578.name: Nice place to take a stroll
303784578.author: a TripAdvisor user
303784578.reviewBody: Lots of shops and historical sites ... a perfect place to shop, have a drink or meal and people watch.

301663089.name: Nice town
301663089.author: a TripAdvisor user
301663089.reviewBody: Easy to navigate, cute town, interesting stores and galleries including a few high end ones.  Worth a visit.  Take a taxi or the red bus.

298905208.name: Gorgeous shops and restaurants!
298905208.author: a TripAdvisor user
298905208.reviewBody: Love looking through every shop.  So many interesting items, big and small, inexpensive and expensive, something for everyone!  Great restaurants with phenomal food, and beautiful decor!\nMake sure you check out Sergio Bustamante\'s gallery......stunning pieces!  (unfortunately, taking photos is a no-no there!)

294550608.name: Independencia Avenue Tlaquepaque - a People Place
294550608.author: a TripAdvisor user
294550608.reviewBody: Plenty of restaurants, shops and street vendors - adjacent to a nice park and cathedral, it\'s a very popular area, no cars allowed, always a lot of people there - music, entertainment, etc., etc.

288996442.name: An upscale shopping area in the Guadalajara suburb of Tlaquepaque
288996442.author: a TripAdvisor user
288996442.reviewBody: Avenida Independencia is a pedestrian only shopping area of Tlaquepaque that provides the driver with a break from the traffic and an opportunity to get out and take in some of the sights. There\'s a great variety of shops and a good selection of restaurants to be found here. Whether its souvenirs, home decorations, jewelry or designer furniture that\'s on your shopping list this is the place to find what you are looking for and more.

286197210.name: Shoppers\' Row!
286197210.author: a TripAdvisor user
286197210.reviewBody:
My daughter who lives in Guadalajara with her husband really enjoys Tlaquepaque and we went there on our first full day in Mexico...three women and two men. 
There is something for everyone, and if you're not a shopper, benches abound and there are many sights to see.

We visited sweet shops, ceramics and glass places, plus handicraft and gift stores, sometimes just looking and other times, well, spending $$$!

The street is closed to traffic, so leisurely strolling and enjoying the sculptures is pleasant.

Would recommend this visit if you have the time!

286019948.name: Nice place to walk around Gudalajara
286019948.author: a TripAdvisor user
286019948.reviewBody: This car free area has many shops and restaurants. As a tourist I felt very safe. There was a park with folklore dancers. Very nice experience.

284838187.name: This is the street to visit if you have little time
284838187.author: a TripAdvisor user
284838187.reviewBody: Independencia is closed off to the cars - so you can walk without being run over!! It has great restaurants and stores - probably a bit more pricey than the other streets because it is the upscale street. There are designers there that can specially make furniture for you if you like! \nLove Independencia and Casa Fuerte Restaurant!\n

283458890.name: Some gems among the tat
283458890.author: a TripAdvisor user
283458890.reviewBody: You can find some interesting shops if you look past the ones that cater to mass tourism by selling cheap junk.  Artesanias Maya-Inka has nice clothing and other items from Yucatan.

273894151.name: Remarkably Over Rated
273894151.author: a TripAdvisor user
273894151.reviewBody:
Having read reviews in TripAdvisor, I ended up for three days in Tlaquepaque.  Reading the reviews, one might think they are heading for a true art mecca, on the order of Carmel, California; ; a place where a large number of world class artists display original art.  The heart of this "Art Scene" is suppose to be Avenida Independencia.  There are lots of shops on this pedestrian street, but very few have original art.  There are textiles made by machine and pottery that can be found in any street fair in the EUA.    

    To be fair, there is a charming atmosphere.  There were always lots of people shopping, eating ice cream, etc and enjoying the Mexican ambiance.  

    But at the end of the day, this was a place where you could drop in for three hours and it would be more than enough.  Perhaps you might enjoy a meal at one of the high priced restaurants.  Avenida Independencia is truly a mediocre shopping street in gay clothing and I would be very surprised if someone were to find a remarkable piece of art there.

267866723.name: Lovely
267866723.author: a TripAdvisor user
267866723.reviewBody: Great restaurants, lovely shops with marvelous pieces of art, handcrafts, ceramic, textiles, furniture -- the list goes on and on. Highly recommended.

265940943.name: Great shopping
265940943.author: a TripAdvisor user
265940943.reviewBody: Shops are full of high quality art, furniture and textiles. Restaraunts, cafes and even a bar are spaced out along the street so you can people watch to your hearts content.  I had fun while shopping and that\'s a good thing.

263160502.name: Lively any evening of the week
263160502.author: a TripAdvisor user
263160502.reviewBody: Always a pleasant stroll. Lots of local whole families with happy kids enjoying their boutiquey little town, walking, laughing, eating.

252397388.name: very cool shops
252397388.author: a TripAdvisor user
252397388.reviewBody: Very high end well crafted furniture and art. the street also has many restaurants. It\'s pedestrian only so it\'s fun to wander.

252013321.name: Touristy but still appealing
252013321.author: a TripAdvisor user
252013321.reviewBody: Independencia is essentially traffic free and it\'s fun to walk and browse in the handicraft stores and explore the cafes and restaurants.

250997234.name: Top tips for visiting Tlaquepaque Independencia Avenue, Mexico
250997234.author: a TripAdvisor user
250997234.reviewBody:
- How to get there? If you are setting off from Guadalajara, Bus 275B, 275 Diagonal or TUR marked ‘Tlaquepaque’ at Av 16 de Septiembre and Madero. To return to Guadalajara, take the bus opposite where you stop and look out for the signboard 'Centro'. Bus trip will take about 30 - 45 mins each way.

If you are not sure where to stop, just stop where everybody gets off or gets off one stop after the university students.

- WOW! If you are into ceramic or clay pot or artistic painting kind of stuff, this is the town you should visit. I am not someone who is interested in artistic pieces or ceramic pottery but this town blown me away! Even the prices are reasonable, not too expensive at all. I even saw a very old vintage Singer Sewing Machine selling for only $300. I trust if this item is sold in America, it would be 10 times the price.

- The ceramic collection is tremendous, it will take you a whole day too walk around the shops and find the best bargain.

- Remember to bring sunscreen or a heat because there is not many sheltered walkway.

- Food are quite pricey at Tlaquepaque so make sure you go there with a full tummy. 

If you think my reviews have been helpful to you, please click 'Yes' for 'Was this review helpful?'

250537286.name: Shop, shop, shop
250537286.author: a TripAdvisor user
250537286.reviewBody: Lots of shops and historical sites. Plenty of places for the men to sit while the wife\'s shop. It is just a fun place to people watch.

250096062.name: A great Amble of a Walk
250096062.author: a TripAdvisor user
250096062.reviewBody: So much to see, walk by, poke your head into, spend some time in. Galleries, furniture and crafts. We bought nothing, sourced an old door, enjoyed the afternoon of ambling immensely.

249605539.name: What a great place to wander!
249605539.author: a TripAdvisor user
249605539.reviewBody: Beautiful, clean and tasteful... a perfect place to shop, have a drink or meal and people watch.  There is always something to discover on Independencia Avenue.  We were there prior to the Day of the Dead festivities, and we were so sorry to leave!  The entire street was festively decorated with altars.  The air was heavy with the scent of marigolds.  Katrinas of all ages were enjoying a walkabout in their finery.  Loved it!

242622176.name: You don\'t have to buy, to enjoy shopping
242622176.author: a TripAdvisor user
242622176.reviewBody: Peaceful yet lively pedestrian street with restaurants, galleries, artisans\' shops. Even if you aren\'t buying anything, it is a lot of fun to wander into the shops to see the amazing handiwork of the ceramics, wood, metal, glass, etc.

241902705.name: Amazing Local Art
241902705.author: a TripAdvisor user
241902705.reviewBody: This is well worth your time to explore the amazing galleries and shops!!  They are filled with local art!!

195675449.name: Walk Independencia Avenue!
195675449.author: a TripAdvisor user
195675449.reviewBody:
This is a cobblestone street in the middle of Tlaquepaque , GDL, that is excellent for tourists who want to feel like a local. Walk up and down the street and you'll find excellent shopping housed in old, beautiful converted buildings. The street is a long row of businesses and restaurants, and I spent about 4 hours with my boyfriend walking it.

We ate lunch, shopped, wandered, saw cultural sights and had cocktails outside on the avenue. It was such an awesome way to spend an afternoon, and we just happened upon it!

I want more people to know about this area! You could spend a day there, and I'd definitely go back to shop and sip drinks all along Independence again!
